===Orphaned Pages===

The following list shows those pages held in the Wiki that are not linked to on any other pages.

{{OrphanedPages}}{{nocomments}}


----
CategoryWiki

===This wiki is using a very flexible but simple categorizing system to keep everything properly organized.===

{{Category page="/"  col="10"}}
==Here's how it works :==
~- The master list of the categories is **Category Category** (//without the space//) which will automatically list all known maincategories, and should never be edited. This list is easily accessed from the Wiki's top navigation bar. (Categories).
~- Each category has a WikiName name of the form ""CategoryName"" for example CategoryWiki etc. (see list of maincategories above)
~- Pages can belong to zero or more categories. Including a page in a category is done by simply mentioning the ""CategoryName"" on the page (by convention at the very end of the page).
~- The system allows to build hierarchies of categories by referring to the parent category in the subcategory page. The parent category page will then automatically include the subcategory page in its list.
~- A special kind of category is **""Category Users""** (//without the space//) to group the userpages, so your Wiki homepage should include it at the end to be included in the category-driven userlist.
~- New categories can be created (think very hard before doing this though, we don't need too much of them) by creating a ""CategoryName"" page, including ""{{Category}}"" in it and placing it in the **Category Category** (//without the space//) category (for a main category or another parent category in case you want to create a subcategory).

**Please help to keep this place organized by including the relevant categories in new and existing pages !**

**Notes:** 
~- The above bold items above //include spaces// to prevent this page from showing up in the mentioned categories. This page only belongs in CategoryWiki (which can be safely mentioned) after all !
~- In order to avoid accidental miscategorization you should **avoid** mentioning a non-related ""CategoryName"" on a page. This is a side-effect of how the categorizing system works: it's based on a textsearch and is not restricted to the footer convention.
~- Don't be put of by the name of this page (WikiCategory) which is a logical name (it's about the Wiki and explains Category) but doesn't have any special role in the Categorizing system.
~- To end with this is the **standard convention** to include the categories (both the wiki code and the result):

%%==Categories==
CategoryWiki%%

==Categories==
CategoryWiki

=== The Wiki Formatting Guide ===

Anything between 2 sets of double-quotes is ignored and presented exactly as typed (that means the formatting commands below are ignored whenever surrounded by double double-quotes.)

Once you've read through this, test your formatting skills in the SandBox.
----
===Basic formatting:===

	""**I'm bold text!**""
	**I'm bold text!**

	""//I'm italic text!//""
	//I'm italic text!//

	""And I'm __underlined__!""
	And I'm __underlined__!

	""##monospace text##""
	##monospace text##

	""''highlight text''"" (using 2 single-quotes)
	''highlight text''

	""++Strike through text++""
	++Strike through text++

	""Press #%ANY KEY#%""
	Press #%ANY KEY#%

	""@@Center text@@""
	@@Center text@@

 ===Headers:===
	""====== Really big header ======""
	====== Really big header ======
	
	""===== Rather big header =====""
	===== Rather big header =====
	
	""==== Medium header ===="" 
	==== Medium header ====
	
	""=== Not-so-big header ==="" 
	=== Not-so-big header ===
	
	""== Smallish header =="" 
	== Smallish header ==

===Horizontal separator:===
	""----""
----

===Forced line break:===
	""---""
---
----
===Lists / Indents:===
Indent text using **4** spaces (which will auto-convert into tabs) or using "~". To make bulleted / ordered lists, use the following codes (you can use 4 spaces instead of "~"):

""~- bulleted list:""
	- bulleted list
	- Line two

""~1) numbered list:""
	1) numbered list
	1) Line two

""~A) Using uppercase characters:""
	A) Using uppercase characters
	A) Line two

""~a) Using lowercase characters:""
	a) Using lowercase characters
	a) Line two

""~I) using uppercase roman numerals:""
	I) using Latin numbers
	I) Line two

""~i) using lowercase roman numerals:""
	i) using Latin numbers
	i) Line two

----
===Wiki Extensions:===

==Images:==

To place images on a Wiki page, use:
""{{image class="center" alt="DVD logo" title="An Image Link" url="images/dvdvideo.gif" link="RecentChanges"}}""
{{image class="center" alt="dvd logo" title="An Image Link" url="images/dvdvideo.gif" link="RecentChanges"}}
Links can be external, or internal Wiki links. You don't have to enter a link at all, and in that case just an image will be inserted. You can also use the classes 'left' and 'right' to float images left and right. You don't need to use all those attributes, only url is essential.

==Tables:==

To create a table use this code:
""{{table columns="3" cellpadding="1" cells="BIG;GREEN;FROGS;yes;yes;no;no;no;###"}}"" to give:

{{table columns="3" cellpadding="1" cells="BIG;GREEN;FROGS;yes;yes;no;no;no;###"}}

""###"" means the cell is empty.

==Coloured Text:==

""{{colour c="blue" text="This is a test."}}"" gives:

{{colour c="blue" text="This is a test."}}

If you want to use hex values:

""{{colour hex="#DD0000" text="This is another test."}}"" to give:

{{colour hex="#DD0000" text="This is another test."}}
	

----

 **Left floated box - use two < signs before and after the block**
	<<Some text in a floated box hanging around<<Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler.

	**Right floated box, use two > characters before and after the block**
	>>Some text in a floated box hanging around>>Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler. Some more text as a filler.

	""Use ::c::  to clear floated blocks...""

----

""%%code%%:""
%%
int main(int arc,char **argv)
{
	printf("Hello, %s!
", (argc>1) ? argv[1] : "World");
	return 0;
}
%%

[Version]

[Info]  #background info
Name=Munin++ Menu

Author=NonTroppo (originally by Rijk van Geijtenbeek)
Version=1.9
%%

%%(php) 
<?php
phpinfo();
 = "Hello, World!
";
print "";?>
%%

	""%%(email) Email message%%:"" 
%%(email) 
Hi!
>>>> My Llama loves foot massage.
>>> You really think so?
>> Yes, I know he does.
>Are you sure?

Of course, yes!

Mr. Scruff
%%

===FAQ:===
//Question: How do you un-WikiName a word ?//
Answer: Add two pair of double-quotes around the word: ""WikiName""

//Question: How do you get a pair of double-quotes (without any text between them) to display properly ?//
Answer: Use the entity literal ##&quot;## - ##&quot&quot;##

//Question: How does Wakka Wiki know to what URL to send a visitor to if it wasn't specified ?//
Answer: The link is to a forced WikiPage. That means a link to a page in this wiki is generated.

//Question: So why does ""[[LALA_LELE]]"" send me to http://LALA_LELE ?//
Answer: The underscore breaks things. ""[[LALALELE]]"" doesn't have this problem.

The [[Mediterranean Mediterranean Sea]] is an intercontinental sea positioned between Europe to the north, Africa to the south and Asia to the east, covering an approximate area of 2.5 million square kilometres. The term [[Mediterranean]] derives from the [[Latin]] //mediterraneus//, 'inland' (//medius//, 'middle' and //terra//, 'land' or 'earth').

The [[Mediterranean Mediterranean Sea]] is connected to the Atlantic Ocean by the Strait of Gibraltar on the west and to the Sea of Marmara and Black Sea, by the Dardanelles and the Bosporus respectively, on the east. The Sea of Marmara is often considered a part of the [[Mediterranean Mediterranean Sea]], whereas the Black Sea is generally not. The man-made Suez Canal in the south-east connects the [[Mediterranean Mediterranean Sea]] with the Red Sea.

Tides are very limited in the Mediterreanean as a result of the narrow connection with the ocean.

A TextFile is a file on a computer systm which contains only text. Can be created in many ways, such as with MicrosoftNotePad or [[ViEditor Vim]]. However, you should never use [[EmacsEditor Emacs]] to create a text file. It'll probably end up with a copy of Sokoban embedded or something.

----
[[BoringTechyPages See other BoringTechyPages]]

One fundamental thing that OperatingSystems can't agree on, is how to delimit the end of a line in a TextFile.

Unix uses the ASCII character 32, while DOS (and it's derivatives, MicrosoftWindows) uses 15.

Here is an easy way to convery a file with DOS linebreaks to a file with Unix linebreaks:

# tr -d '\15\32' < dos-format-file > unix-friendly-file

ChezGrunt is an add-on to SteveJacksonGames' card game ChezGeek. In this add-on, players are in the army and special rules come in to effect, such as those regarding keeping illicit things ("Thing (Illicit)") in your bunkhouse. It can be played independently of the main ChezGeek set, or with it (in which case the players are all reservists).

BillHicks was a StandUpComic who lived out much of his career in relative anonymity. He grew up in a God-fearing Texan family and after developing a gift for stand-up at school he would sneek out of his room at night to perform in his local comedy club.

After dropping out of college BillHicks moved to LosAngeles to begin his career but soon left for NewYork, partially due to the fact that LosAngeles weather did not agree with his dress sense. Whilst Hicks would do spectacularly in a club atmosphere his extreme opposition to commercialism kept him out of the [[TV]] scene by not only the reluctance of [[TV]] executives to pick him up but with his vehement distaste to his being censored or controlled in any way.

A comedy special that he did do for [[TV]] in America was broadcast on ChannelFour over here unedited leading to a much more informed opinion of his act (viewers of Hicks' [[TV]] special in America were shocked by his vulgarity and eviscerative dealing of hecklers when they saw him live) and hence a distinct cult following. This British cult following was great enough to warrant a limited tour.

The majority of Hicks' act centred around satirising and criticising the government, media and just about any institution larger than an individual with occasional, improvised flights of fancy. He was a distinctive voice in favour of drug taking, yet another factor that kept him from mainstream comedy. He stressed that drugs had positive effects as well as negative and highlighted the media bias in only covering the negative.

Towards the end of his unfortunately and unnaturally short career his act became more refined and more pointed in it's satire and relied less upon vulgarity and irreverence however he suffered a massive blow to his confidence when a set that he performmed for his friend [[DavidLettermansLateShow]] was unbroadcast for vague reasons by uncertain persons. He felt betrayed by a friend, doubly so in that he couldn't find out who had called for the censure. He refused to perform again for the show, despite a number of invitations, and went back to comedy clubs. During what was to be his last performance he simply stopped in the middle of hsi set, called his agent to the front and said that he was done. Few knew what he knew.

He died of pancreatic cancer on the 26th of February 1996.

HayFever is a comic play written by Noel Coward in 1924 and first produced in 1925. Best described as a cross between high farce and a comedy of manners, the play is set in a British country house in the 1920s, and deals with the four eccentric members of the Bliss family and their outlandish behaviour when they each invite a guest to spend the weekend. Following on from the success of his earlier play TheVortex, HayFever was an enormous hit on the WestEnd stage and has been revived countless times around the world since then. It was the 1966 National Theatre production of HayFever, starring Maggie Smith and Edith Evans with Coward himself directing, which sparked the revival of interest in his work toward the end of his life.

=== [[FullStopRationing FullStopRationing]] ===

Our FullStop supplies grow lower every day - those from less fortunate backgrounds can't even gather enough [[FullStop FullStops]] to feed their sentences and allow them to speak in a non-disjointed way Here at RockMonkey we feel quite strongly about this issue, and DanHuntley is leading a campaign to conserve [[FullStop FullStops]] on the RockMonkey web site, in a show of empathy towards less-fortunate punctuators

Please support this campaign - reduce FullStop usage on all the pages within your responsibility and include a link back to this WikiPage to show our unity in this cause - simply put the following code on your website to show that you care, and follow our tips, below, to help reduce your FullStop usage:

----
@@**""''I support FullStopRationing - read more about [[FullStopRationing the campaign]]''""**@@
Please note that that's two single quotes, not a double-quote, at each end!
----

== Tips To Reduce FullStop Usage ==

~- Try to write long sentences that cover as many topics as possible before you need to take a break in the flow because there is no shortage of words of any variety and you will use very few more words than you would otherwise but you will save many punctuation marks of all kinds
~- Use other forms of punctuation! Are you aware that other punctuation marks; be they commas, colons, or brackets (which are used to delimit interdependent concepts within a phrase), are in abundance?
~- Use bullet points when presenting lists, and neglect to put [[FullStop FullStops]] at the end
~- Feel free to add your own tips to this page!

----

==== BadPagesNoContent ====

It is considerered [[BadPages bad wiki etiquette]] to create a WikiPage which has no content on it whatsoever, or to remove all of the content from an existing WikiPage. Pages which remain 'undefined' should appear on the 'WantedPages' list, but if people 'blank' pages then this doesn't happen, because it **is** a defined page... albeit a blank one.

Repairing 'blank' pages is even more noble - and more worthy of [[WikiGnome WikiGnome-dom]] - than defining WantedPages.

If you disagree with the content of a WikiPage: ammend it with the facts, or append to it your opinion. Blanking [[WikiPage WikiPages]] is very bad form, and it only takes a second for somebody to click the 'History' link and roll back to the original page!

[[www.nicecupofteaandasitdown.com Website found here]].

By golly we can't be doing without this, now can we? It's integral to [[Life]]. It makes almost everything better. When you're sat around not knowing what you need you can bank on the fact that what's missing is a NiceCupOfTeaAndASitDown.

One of the huge factors in this activity is the [[Tea tea]]. Please note the abscence of a capital letter -- especially when compared to [[Coffee]] -- because it's a laid back drink. You have this to calm the world down. Had AdolfHitler sat down with a good cuppa earlier in his 'career' then who knows what might have gone differently?

Now, as I was saying, tea is essential when enjoying the aforementioned activity and therefore many people seek clarification; what sort of [[Tea tea]]? Can we have biscuits? How long should the [[Tea tea]] brew? What sort of biscuits can we have? Do we need to use a teapot? We experience drinkers-of-tea and sitters-of-down forgive them their youthful exuberance. Once they've had a NiceCupOfTeaAndASitDown they'll realise the truth, the simple truth: stop fussing, it'll turn out right in the end.

A //suggestion// on the sitting down side side of things is that you aim more for a slump than a slouch. A good rule of thumb is to imagine that you're visiting older realives; you don't have to be prim and proper but you can't exactly lie down over the sofa. Besides, if you're slouching like that you'll probably spill your [[Tea tea]].

The reason not to spill your [[Tea tea]], aside from the fact that you can't drink what you've spilt down your shirt, is because the [[Tea tea]] will be hot. Some people are more familiar with the drink of iced tea //<spit>//. This drink is an **abomination**. That's all there is to say about that.

IfYouReadThis you should go and have a NiceCupOfTeaAndASitDown.

Jabber is an open-source instant messaging protocol.

Why should you give a shit?

Because Jabber can be used as the 'glue' to translate messages from, say, MSN Messenger to ICQ. Or from AIM to Yahoo. Or just about anything.

This means that there should be no more moaning about what IM service to use. Everyone can get a Jabber client (suggest: [[http://www.imendio.com/projects/gossip/ Gossip for Linux]], [[http://exodus.jabberstudio.org/ Exodus for Windows]], [[http://nitro.jabberstudio.org/ Nitro for MacOSX]]), set it up, and then everyone can talk to everyone regardless of their preferred brand of proprietary lock-in.

A full list of Jabber clients is avaliable [[http://www.jabber.org/software/clients.php here]]

See PeopleWhoUseJabber

[[WikiBridgePuzzlePAJ00SRL Restart Puzzle]]

==== WikiBridgePuzzle ====

This game is a [[WikiGames Wiki-based]] re-interpretation of an old puzzle, by DanHuntley.

----

=== Instructions ===
[[PaulMann Paul]], [[AndyKeohane Andy]], [[MisterJTA JTA]], [[SuzChilestone Suz]], [[RuthVarley Ruth]] and [[LizHague Liz]] all want to cross over the same, narrow bridge at the same time. The boys - Paul, Andy and JTA - want to cross the bridge from left to right. The girls - Suz, Ruth and Liz - want to cross the bridge from right to left. There are spaces for eight people on the bridge, and these six start at the two ends (leaving two empty spaces in the middle).

Clicking on a person will cause them to try to move accross the bridge. The boys will always try to move to the right, and the girls will always try to move to the left. There are two kinds of moves:

~- If the space in front of the person moving is //unoccupied//, the person will slide forwards into that space.
~- If the space in front of the person moving is //occupied// by a member of the opposite sex, the person will try to "leapfrog" over them into an unoccupied space behind them. People cannot leapfrog over people of the same gender, and they cannot leapfrog if there is no free space behind the person they are leap-frogging over.

If there is no free space to move to, a person cannot move.

Paul, Andy, JTA, Suz, Ruth and Liz are all very stubborn (especially Paul) and will not take a step backwards along the bridge for any reason (the boys will always only move to the right, and the girls will always only move to the left). For this reason, you must be careful not to put yourself into a position where they all get 'stuck'!

You must get everybody accross the bridge.

----
==== @@[[WikiBridgePuzzlePAJ00SRL Click Here To Start Puzzle]]@@ ====
----
=== About The Game ===

This game was developed over the course of a day by DanHuntley. Despite efforts to the contrary, it's possible that wiki pages might not exist that should! If this happens to you (and when you click on a person to cause them to move you find yourself on an 'Edit' page), please leave a note on **this** page so that it can be found and corrected (please do **not** define them yourselves as this makes finding them more difficult!).

I've just (5th November 2004) added a few more 'missing' pages. I apologise again for the problems with this game, but sadly [[MattInTheHat somebody]] started playing it and 'filling in' pages before they were finished, thereby causing dozens of pages to have to be re-done by hand. We're getting there. The puzzle can now be 'solved' by a vast number of routes.

Please feel free to add "flavour" comments to describe the //positions// the people on the bridge find themselves in, underneath the pictures. For example, //"Paul rocks the bridge... again..."//. Do remember, however, that other players may not have gotten to the same position as you by the same route as you, so make sure your messages make sense alone, not just in succession.

If you like this game, see other WikiGames on RockMonkey, including WikiMaze, by JonAtkinson, and WikiPlatformGame, by DanHuntley. Or go look at RuthVarley's ActivityOMatic!

TheDevTeamThinkOfEverything, usually abbreviated to TDTTOE, is a phrase used by accomplished NetHack players who are surprised for the millionth time that the development team //really do// think of anything. For example, if you eat from a can which turns out to get your hands greasy... but you're currently polymorphed into a creature of a kind that //doesn't have hands//, the game (correctly) adapts the sentence to fit (e.g. "Your paws become greasy.", "You now have greasy tentacles."). And if you look into a mirror while hallucinating and polymorphed into a creature with a sight-based petrification ability, you become kind-of entrapped in the gaze of the beast in the mirror, but then it goes away... and... it's just an immensely clever game.

See also DansSilliestNetHackDeath, MisterJTAsSilliestNetHackDeath (WTF?)

@@===Welcome to WikiMaze===@@
----
~-The objective of WikiMaze is to guide your character, the FleebleWidget, through the damp corridors under PenbrynHalls, to the secret computer room where you can edit RockMonkey pages in peace. However, the terrible [[Splurg]] stalks these forgotten passages, ready to devour any unsuspecting victims.
~-You can choose your moves at will, but beware, because once you take a step you can never go back.
~-As you move around the maze, creative thoughts may besiege your mind. Please do feel free to edit the descriptions of the areas to make the game more atmospheric.
~-Watch out for [[Lesbians]] and [[HardCorePorn TubGirl]]. While rare, they can both cause instant death in the maze.
---
@@===About WikiMaze===@@
----
~-WikiMaze was created in about 2 hours. The old graphics were done using Paint, the newer graphics come from Dungeon Master Java, and the graphics are under the GPL
~-WikiMaze is based on a grid system. If you check the title of the node you're at, you can find out where you are on the map. The first number is the x axis, the second number the y axis. There might be some areas that are unaccessible through normal play - search hard enough and you might find the cheat code!
~-That's about it.
~-If you enjoyed WikiMaze, why not try WikiPlatformGame and WikiBridgePuzzle, two of the other WikiGames on RockMonkey.
---

This page demonstrates the WikiGameToolkit ""'InvHasNone'"" directive:

To make a link which only appears if a player **does not** have a particular item, use:

%%{{InvHasNone item="Bowl Of Porridge" link="WikiGameToolkitDemoGoHungry" text="Wish you had some porridge?"}}%%

{{InvHasNone item="Bowl Of Porridge" link="WikiGameToolkitDemoGoHungry" text="Wish you had some porridge?"}}

Just like ""InvHasOne"", ""InvHasNone"" allows multiple items to be tested for (just seperate each with a slash). Only if the player has //none// of the items listed does the link appear.

====RestlessWorld====

Welcome to RestlessWorld. A wiki-based adventure by RestlessBoy. 

You play the part of an intrepid explorer, charged by PeterHain to go forth and find the SceptreOfZanatoth and save [[Wales]] from cultural malaise.

At the start of this adventure you have no objects and have eaten no food. You may want to note down the objects and advice you acquire on your journey. If played properly, this game is really difficult to win. But obviously you're all gonna cheat so just go ahead and enjoy.

There are many ways to lose/get killed so please sign the comments box of any Game Over page you arrive at. And please let me know if you enjoyed this game cos it took me quite a while to make.

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Under The Pier ===
----
You tie a heavy rock to one end of the rope, and fling it over one of the heavy iron bars that criss-cross underneath the pier. Lowering the rock to the ground by slackening the rope, you perform a quick cross-hitch to secure it, and being to climb. A few seconds later, the iron bar - rusted almost right through - breaks, sending you falling back down to the beach, dodging rust and metal shards as you land.

Yiddish for dick
[[Lesbia]] is an imaginary island in the SouthPacific, about a hundred miles east of SouthernIceland, and populated entirely by [[Lesbians]]. Not to be confused with [[Lesbos]].
A word that makes you feel either really good or really bad, about yourself. At time of writing AndyKeohane is liking this word as has just been for a run down into town and back.

20 miles from the house of AlecR is the fine and ancient city of oxford with it's dreaming spires, wealthy colleges and criminally violent suburbs. It's a lovely place well worth a visit, it has a good modern art gallery which has had all the big names come through, many fine eateries, a friendly gay quarter, many historic sites of "interest", the first HobGoblin pub, and all the shops you'd expect. 

Visits can be arranged

WychwoodBrewery make HobGoblin, CircleMaster, FiddlersElbow and [[Goliath]], all of which are very nice types of RealAle. People in AberWorld can have difficulty getting HobGoblin, but FiddlersElbow is very popular in TheFlat come TromaNight.

MisterJTA once looked all over their website - http://www.wychwood.co.uk/ - in the hope that he could find one of their 'Largerboy' posters in the shop (which shows the legendary HobGoblin clutching a pint of the eponymous brew and demanding "What's the matter, LagerBoy, afraid you might taste something?") and couldn't find one.

As a result, MisterJTA e-mailed the lovely people of the WychwoodBrewery, and they sent him two HobGoblin posters for free.

So go buy their beer!

**"You know, this game is really hard! Do you have some kind of hint book or something?"**

//"We had a hint book, yes: but I'm afraid it's been damaged almost beyond use in a recent fire. All we've got left is this one page..."//

The receptionist shows you a charred piece of paper. Those parts which are legible read:

----
...ue Rock ca. be obt..n.d b. ..seil... do.. ..e .... of the ......... ...........

**... ... d. I get the bucket o.. the man's head in the NationalLibraryOfWales?**
You need to apply soap to the bucket to lu..icate it.

**68. W.ere do I g.t the soap?**
The bar of soap can be found in the kitchen a. BranwensRestaurant. You will need to tell the chef that you are t.. new dishwasher to get in there.

**69. Where is the hintbook?**
The hintbook is in the NationalLibraryOfWales. You will need to speak to the receptionist to get it.

**70. How do I get the receptionist at the NationalLibraryOfWales to speak to me? She ignores me in favour of the man with a bucket on his head?**
You need to get the bucket off the man's head (clue 67) before the receptionist can talk to you.

**71. The copy of the hintbook at the NationalLibraryOfWales is fire damaged, a.d . ..n.t re.. i..**
T. ..t th. re.. hint..o.; y.. ..l. ne.d .. ..m... ..n...t... a.d a.. .im ...y n..el.y f.. a ..u..

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Bottom Of Constitution Hill ===
----
You are at the bottom of Constitution Hill, which dominates the Northern end of [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]]'s skyline. It is possible to go down to the beach from here{{InvHasNone item="AndyKeohane" text=", where you can see a figure moving around and pickup up rocks"}}. Alternatively, roads lead South and Southeast, to the promenade and around the back of the seafront buildings, respectively. And, it's always possible to climb up the hill. The cliff railway building is locked with a crude padlock. {{InvHasOne item="MisterJTA" text="MisterJTA idly jangles his enormous bunches of keys."}} {{Test if="!hasItem(AndyKeohane)" then="~{Test if=~hasItem(JonAtkinson)~ then=~JonAtkinson points out a figure moving around on the beach, looking at rocks, and suggests that it could be AndyKeohane.~ else=~Somebody is moving around on the beach, looking for something.~}~"}} An aging manhole rests inset into the road.

Down a slight gradient, to the East, lies the rest of Great Darkgate Steet and central [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]]. To the West, you can clearly make out the remaining freestanding tower of [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] Castle. ==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] Castle ===
----
You are in the grounds of [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] Castle.

{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Castle" url="/TromaNightAdventure/castle-t.jpg"}}

//The last castle built at Aberystwyth was its most imposing, and once ranked among the greatest in [[Wales]]. Today, the structure is entirely ruined, a forlorn jumble of towers and foundations most striking for their proximity to the pounding waters of the temperamental sea. For centuries before the castle's construction, the Welsh had proved quarrelsome, wanting their own Prince of Wales and demanding their independence. In the middle of the 13th century, Henry III attempted to appease the Welsh. When he officially named Llywelyn ap Gruffydd as the Prince of Wales, the English king recognized the Welshman's power and charisma. However, the title did not quiet the native Welsh prince, and in the early 1270's, Llywelyn refused to pay homage to the new king, Edward I. By 1276, Edward lost his patience with what he considered as insolence by Llywelyn and his people, and began his first campaign against the Welsh. 

In 1277, King Edward I ordered the construction of several formidable castles. They included Flint, Rhuddlan, Builth, and Aberystwyth. All these castles have survived and are accessible to the public. Of these four castles, two led the way into the future of castle construction. Designed as concentric fortresses, Rhuddlan and Aberystwyth Castles were innovative structures composed of rings of defenses, walls-within-walls, which allowed guards to defend their stronghold from several heights without firing upon their own men. Of the two castles, Aberystwyth is the most ruined, but in its heyday, the castle was every bit as intimidating and secure as its cousin in North East Wales.//

Several paths lead down from this old fort.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight013 Walk towards town]]
~- [[TromaNight041 Walk towards the pier]]
~- [[TromaNight049 Walk towards South Beach]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Promenade South ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="South Beach" url="/TromaNightAdventure/beachs2.jpg"}}

You find yourself on the Southern part of [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]]'s coastline - the stretch of the promenade that runs parallel to South Beach. South Beach is only a couple of dozen thousand years - a short time, in geological terms - away from being smooth sand, unlike it's pebbley Northern counterpart. The promenade continues to the Northwest, arcing around the hill on which the Castle sits. To the South lies the marina. Many small roads wind off in a Northeasterly direction, towards the town centre.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight041 Follow the promenade North, to the pier]]
~- [[TromaNight062 South, to the marina]]
~- [[TromaNight036 Clamber up to the Castle]]
~- [[TromaNight063 Walk down onto South Beach]]
~- [[TromaNight064 Find your way to the town centre]]

=== The Marina ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Marina" url="/TromaNightAdventure/harbourbtx.jpg"}}

You're stood on the bar: a concrete waterbreak that forms an artificial harbour for [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] marina. At it's far end is a small automated lighthouse with a ladder up the side. Waves crash against the side of the bar and around into the harbour. The lines clatter against the masts of the sailboats as they're caught in the breeze, chaotically whipping music together; like a set of windchimes fighting a storm.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight049 Return to the South Promenade]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== National Library Car Park ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Castle" url="/TromaNightAdventure/lib2-t.jpg"}}

You're in the car park of the NationalLibraryOfWales, who's presence gives [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] more books-per-head than anywhere else in the country. One door stands ajar, beckoning you to enter. The access road runs Northeastward and slightly downhill, towards Penglais hill and down towards town.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight059 Follow the access road back towards Penglais Hill]]
~- [[TromaNight069 Enter the National Library]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Promenade ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Pier" url="/TromaNightAdventure/pierdusk.jpg"}}

You are at the junction of Pier Street and Marine Terrace (the promenade). The pier extends out to sea in an West-Northeasterly direction. Pier street runs off to the South, past HollywoodPizza and towards town. To the Northeast, the prom leads towards the distant Constitution Hill, and to the Southwest, it leads around the war memorial towards South Beach - invisible from here because of the shape of the small hill between here and there that houses the Castle.

PierVideo, [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]]'s best video rental shop, stands open on the pier.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight034 Northeast, towards Constitution Hill]]
~- [[TromaNight049 Southwest, to South Beach]]

~- [[TromaNight036 Up the path to the Castle]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Railway Station ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Pier" url="/TromaNightAdventure/abersign01.jpg"}}

You fight your way against the crowd, hunting for MisterJTA. It's tough to get through them, and you realise that you are travelling in a contraflow direction. You push harder, and you're making progress, but it's hard to keep your eye on [[MisterJTA JTA]] and avoid losing your footing as people flow into and around you.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight007b Push on to find JTA]]
~- [[TromaNight007 Pull back out of the crowd]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== Railway Station ===
----
{{image class="center" alt="Aberystwyth Pier" url="/TromaNightAdventure/abersign01.jpg"}}

As you push on, you catch a glimpse of MisterJTA. He's fighting the crowd, too: trying to get to the other exit. You shout out to him, but he doesn't hear you...

Suddenly, you're pushed over, and you feel the feet of the crowd pounding around you. You roll aside and crawl on, dodging legs as you head towards the last position you saw [[MisterJTA JTA]]. There's a break in the crowd, and you take your opportunity, leaping up and over a group of schoolchildren and landing hard on the concrete on the other side.

You stand up and dust yourself off. MisterJTA is stood in front of you - you successfully escaped the crowd and found him. As the crowd disperses in it's many directions, you realise that you've just managed to find one of the TromaNight crew.

{{InvPickup item="MisterJTA"}}
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight007 Wait for the crowd to finish dispersing]]

=== GreatHall @ AberystwythArtsCentre ===

{{image class="center" alt="Great Hall" url="/TromaNightAdventure/Artscentre01.jpg"}}

You creep over and pick up the handbag. Peering inside, you see an arty-looking DVD and a spiral bound notebook with a pen clipped onto it. You try to look inconspicuous as you make for the door.

//"Ah-hem!"// comes a voice behind you. It's the woman from on-stage, //"I think you'll find that bag belongs to me."//

She snatches her bag back from you, and puts it back beside the stage, before returning to her rehearsal. You hang your head in shame as you leave the GreatHall.
----
**What next?**
~- [[TromaNight100 Rumbled!]]

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== TheFlat ===
----
You are in TheFlat, [[DanHuntley Dan]] and [[ClaireMelton Claire]]'s residence, and home to TromaNight... but there's a problem! Nobody announced TromaNight this week!

[[DanHuntley Dan]] speaks to you frankly: //"This is a disaster,"// he says, //"And you're the only one who can help!"//

//"I need you to go out and fix everything so that TromaNight can be a success. You must go and collect alcohol, order the pizza, and find the films that we are to watch. After this you must round up the TromaNight veterans and get them here. **You are our last hope!**//

==== [[RockMonkeySessions RockMonkey Sessions]] ====

[[RockMonkeySessions RockMonkey Sessions]] is a cookie-based technology - provided by the WikiGameToolkit - that allows [[WikiGames WikiGame]]-developers to implement //persistance//, in the form of "items" (which are carried around with the RockMonkey user) and "tokens" (which are kept invisibley with the the user's session). These can be cleared by the user at any time, and will automatically clear themselves upon logout or after 20 minutes (or thereabouts) of inactivity.

----
For more information, see WikiGameToolkit.

==== TromaNightAdventure ====
=== North Beach ===
----
You are on the Southern part of North beach. There is no way up to the promenade from here, as a result of the sheer height of the sea wall. Further Southwest, you can make out the iron legs of the pier where they are embedded within the harder slate of that part of the beach. To the Northeast, the beach continues, arcing into a concave bay as it turns Northwards. You can make out the lights, to the Northeast, of the promenade hotels.
----
**What next?** {{Test if="hasItem(Picture Of A Rock)" then="\n~- [[TromaNight083 Look for a rock for Andy]]"}} {{Test if="hasItem(Picture Of A Rock) and !hasItem(Fake Blue Rock) and !hasItem(AndyKeohane) and hasItem(Blue Paint)" then="\n~- [[TromaNight238 Paint a rock blue]]"}}
~- [[TromaNight042 Walk North, up the beach]]
~- [[TromaNight053 Walk South, under the pier]] {{Test if="hasItem(Length Of Rope)" text="\n~- [[TromaNight078 Use your rope to climb the sea wall]]"}} {{Test if="hasItem(AndyKeohane)" text="\n~- [[TromaNight256 Ask Andy, 'What's That Rock?']]"}}

All manner of cool things can be bought here, at any hour of the day or night. On one of the top shelves, too high for you to reach, they keep pornographic films.

===== [[TromaNightAdventure Troma Night Adventure]] =====
----
==== About TromaNightAdventure ====

This is a [[WikiGames WikiGame]] by DanHuntley, powered by the WikiGameToolkit.

In TromaNightAdventure you must quest to save TromaNight, collecting the films, refreshments, and the stars, and putting on a show.

If you want to play, just click below:

==== @@[[TromaNightAdventure000 Start The Game!]]@@ ====

=== Current Max. Score: 175 (6 Stars + 5 Films + 3 Pizzas + RealAle + Some Extras) ===

This game uses RockMonkeySessions: you will need to be logged in to play this game, and if you do not do anything for about 20 minutes all of your objects and tokens will be lost, and you will need to start the game again.

----

==== More About The Game ====

The game is unique amongst all known WikiGames that exist to-date in the following areas:

~- **Non-Linear**: It's possible to finish this [[WikiGames WikiGame]] in a number of ways. You don't //have// to get all of the TromaNight stars to TromaNight - three (of your choice) will do... but each extra star is worth extra points, and some of the stars have special abilities of thier own which might help you in your quest.

~- **Multiple Solutions**: Each different subquest may have different ways to solve it... and some do not have to be solved at all. Of these, different solutions may provide different numbers of points, but any solution can lead to completion of the game.

~- **Adaptive**: The game responds differently depending on the way in which you go about things. If you take a particular two people to a particular place, you may get a special message (for example, take JonAtkinson and MisterJTA to Wetherspoons and they'll chat about the age of the people being served).

~- **Continuously Growing**: The game will continue to be enhanced over the coming months, adding new features, new ways to win, and other goodies.

----

==== Version History & Bugs ====

Over the initial period of the launch of the game, it's expected that many minor changes (for example, **v0.915**, which basically just improves the conversation skills of AndyKeohane) will be made. Major changes will be highlighted, in order that you can more easily find them - there's no need to play through the game again just because a minor change has been made: wait for a major change!

=== Version History ===
**v1.06** - 11:46, 11th December 2004 - Resized unbelievabley large images to a more believable size.

**v1.05** - 10:56, 10th December 2004 - completed 'empty bullets' fixes. Game now looks cleaner on [[InternetExplorer IE]]/[[MozillaFirefox Firefox]] and doesn't give players an advantage by letting them see bullet points for options that don't yet exist.

**v1.03** - 15:23, 9th December 2004 - fixed 'manhole opener WikiGameToolkit Error' (was caused by typo during 'empty bullets' fixes); thanks [[MisterJTA JTA]] for finding that one! Also fixed 'empty bullets' 218-231.

**v1.02** - 12:26, 9th December 2004 - fixed 'empty bullets' problem on scenes 123-217. Fixed bug in collection and use of handbag that would typically prevent players from getting the Arty Film. Keep reporting bugs back to me!

**v1.01** - 11:35, 9th December 2004 - fixed 'empty bullets' problem on scenes 000-122. Improved conversation with man-with-bucket-on-head (now able to 'free' him at any point in the conversation, not just at the beginning). Improved HollywoodPizza (now not possible to order Pizza With Vegetables if you already have one).

++**v1.0** - MAJOR CHANGE++ - 16:01, 7th December 2004 - now possible to get **full score** (175 points). Arty Film added, made RuthVarley useful, etc.

**v0.92** - 16:35, 6th December 2004 - added pictures to the nature reserve, national library, parts of campus and bits of the prom and beach.

**v0.917** - 13:18, 6th December 2004 - if you 'cheat death' by pressing the back button, the game will deduct 50 points from you if you eventually win.

**v0.916** - 11:26, 6th December 2004 - you can now ask DanHuntley for a list of some of the 'extra challenges' you can do for extra points, and some general tips.

**v0.915** - 10:59, 6th December 2004 - if you have AndyKeohane and you're walking along the beach, you can repeatedly stop to ask him "What kind of rock is that?".

**v0.91** - 17:16, 5th December 2004 - minor bug fixes: [[PaulMann Paul]]'s conversation is cleaned up, formatting is fixed, typo is corrected.

**v0.9** - 14:20, 5th December 2004 - first release. Not possible (yet) to get "Arty Film", but still winnable and still possible to get 165/175 points. Not fully tested - please report bugs by adding to the list, below. Hints not written yet. Conversations with RuthVarley and PaulMann need fleshing out. Feedback welcome.

[[Wales]] is one of the nicest places on [[Earth]]. The people are chilled and friendly, the beer is good and the living is easy. About 20% of the population speak [[WelshLanguage Welsh]] as a first language, but everybody, almost without exception, speaks [[EnglishLanguage English]].

==== VirtualReality ====

=== Summary ===

Reality, as existed in by ComputerScienceStudents (see also LaraCroft) and - alternately - by TheoreticalPhysicists.

=== But Seriously, Folks... ===

We were told by the popular media and films like LawnmowerMan that by the year 2000 VirtualReality would be the NextBigThing: whenever we wanted to be entertained we'd just slip on our [[VirtualReality VR]] goggles and experience something magical. This has turned out not to be the case, and despite several fields in which [[VirtualReality VR]] could be made to be useful, it is not used on account of being 'retro'. It could be said that the VirtualReality revolution came and went in a negative period of time.

[[MediocreFilms MediocreFilm]] about VirtualReality. See [[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0104692/ it's IMDB page]] for more info.

Significantly better than it's sequel, though.

=== UsageStatistics ===

RockMonkey now records UsageStatistics, so that [[AndyKeohane the owner]] can better understand what's going on among the site visitors. Here's some of the more interesting things the logs have revealed:

~- 3rd January 2005: ""BT CentralPlus"" user (using InternetExplorer on [[MicrosoftWindows Windows]] XP) searched on [[http://uk.altavista.com/ AltaVista UK]] for '""RentBoys""'... and got the second result: RentBoys on RockMonkey. I can't help but feel that this result will have been unsatisfactory, and they were evidently looking for something a little dirtier too, because they then clicked the "[[BadPages Bad Pages]]" link in the menu, before being unsatisfied there, too, and leaving.

~- 3rd January 2005: ""BT OpenWorld"" user (using InternetExplorer 6 on [[MicrosoftWindows Windows]] 98) searched on [[http://www.google.co.uk/ Google UK]] for '""jet gladiators games mistress""', using the "pages from the UK" option.  This somehow brought them (second result) to [[Jet our page on Jet]]. They didn't hang around long after that.

~- 5th January 2005: Mystery user (using InternetExplorer 6 on [[MicrosoftWindows Windows]] 98) searched on [[http://search.yahoo.com/ Yahoo! Search]] for "what is a tsunami what is a tidalwave". The results in front of them won't have looked that good... except for one about half-way down the results - a page called [[Tsunami RockMonkey/Tsunami]] who's search summary was "Not a TidalWave...". Wow - just what our searcher was looking for; a definition of the difference between the two. They came to our [[Tsunami]] page, and sadly discovered that in actual fact, *all* it contained was the text "Not a TidalWave." They clicked the link to TidalWave, hoping that would shed some light on the difference... "Surprisingly a wave caused by tides."

~- 21st January 2005: Thanks to much cross-linking and an unusual word, RockMonkey is now the top web site when searching on [[Google]] for [[Lesbeens]].

~- Popular search terms leading people to RockMonkey include: 'thepolice sting', 'hashbrownies', 'mozillafirefox', 'godspeedyoublackemperor', and 'aseriesofunfortunateevents'. Whether these people meant to type [[WikiWord WikiWords]] or just lost the use of thier space bar is not certain.

[[Opera]] is a lovely WebBrowser with some really good skins, a toptastic "personal bar" you can put links to favourite sites on, and a direct link for [[Google]] searches in the main toolbar. O, and automatic blocking of those bloody "WARNING! Your Computer Clock May Be Wrong! Click Here For Adware!" pop-ups.

It bills itself as "Simply the best Internet Experience," which is arguably true. It's probably nicer to look at that MozillaFirefox (I think this is subjective - I find Opera too 'busy' to use the interface, and I don't like banner adverts, and I also hate paying for software - JonAtkinson), and it kicks the //stuffing// out of Internet Explorer ["Simply the Microsoftest Internet Experience"].

==== [[Google]] ====

//Noun// - Popular SearchEngine at http://www.google.com/

//Verb// - To use the [[Google]] SearchEngine. This new verb is also coming to mean, "to search the web," in light of [[Google]]'s popularity. [[Google]] are trying to discourage this, as it could lead to their name becoming a GenericizedTrademark, which would render it's copyright unenforcable and give way to, for example, somebody to open a search engine called "Google For It" or "Web Google".

----

The name "[[Google]]" is an accidental misspelling of the word googol, which was coined in 1938 by MiltonSirotta, nephew of U.S. mathematician EdwardKasner, to refer to the number represented by 1 followed by a hundred zeros. [[Google]]'s use of the term reflects the company's mission to organize the immense amount of information available on the Web.

[[Google]] uses an algorithm called PageRank (contrast [[http://www.google.com/technology/pigeonrank.html PigeonRank]]), and several other secret criteria, to rank web pages that match a given search string. This can be abused by use of vast numbers of cleverly-crafted hyperlinks - a GoogleBomb - which can result in forcing certain results to appear more relevant in [[Google]] than they perhaps should be. PageRank results in strange UsageStatistics on wiki-based web sites like RockMonkey.

Google not only indexes and caches [[HTMLLanguage HTML]] files but also 13 other file types, including [[PortableDocumentFormat PDF]], [[MicrosoftWord Word]] documents, [[MicrosoftExcel Excel]] spreadsheets and plain text files. Except in the case of text files, the cached version is a conversion to [[HTMLLanguage HTML]], allowing those without the corresponding viewer application to read the file.

----

=== DansSilliestNetHackDeath ===

Ava the Wizard had successfully fought his way deep into the DungeonsOfDoom, then back up and down through the GnomishMines. It was down in the mines that he ran into trouble...

Surrounded by monsters and badly injured, he began the age-old NetHack strategy of 'using everything you've got out of blind hope'. Hunting through his inventory, he found a potion of levitation... and a wand of digging! "Yes," he thought, "I'm saved!" He drank the potion, and, floating up the the ceiling, zapped the wand directly upwards, in order to make a hole through which he could escape! But the [[RandomNumberGenerator RNG]] hated him that day, for directly above him on the floor above was a large stone altar.

His gravestone reads: Ava, the Wizard, Killed by a falling altar.

[[TheDevTeamThinkOfEverything TDTTOE]].

Finding a Scroll of Genocide, he chose to wipe out all Dwarves.

He died, and his tombstone, never discovered, probably reads "Genocided by a Berk".

==== Fuck ====

It has been widely-circulated that the [[SwearWords swear word]] [[Fuck]] originally came into being as an acronym - "[[Sex Fornication]] Under Consent of the King" or "For Unlawful Carnal Knowledge" - as a legal term for talking about pre-[[Marriage marital]] [[Sex]]. This has since been debunked as an UrbanLegend.

While the exact origin of "[[Fuck fuck]]" is not known, it does come from a Germanic root and cognates can be found in almost all the Germanic languages. Acronymns are pretty much a 20th century invention. The earliest known acronym is ANZAC (Australia-New Zealand Army Corps), dating to the FirstWorldWar. There are some older words where acronymic phrases were created out of existing words, but none that were created from a phrase until the 20th century.

===Hints and Tips for TheRevengeOfZanatoth===

==Levels==
The game works on many levels. It also has three levels. The first and thrid take place in same location. The second takes place in a completely different location.

To complete each level there is one basic task to do.

Level One: find PeterHain's whereabouts
Level Two: Rescue PeterHain
Level Three: Defeat Zanatoth.

You will not be able to travel to the location in Level Two until you have completed Level One, and you will not be able to come back until you have rescued PeterHain. 

==Objects==

Some of the Objects you will get in the game are not objects as such but things which change your status, or indicate what you've learned. For example you will collect a number of 'Vital Clues' which you can't drop or give to people, but which you can discuss with people. 

Another example: one of the first things you will need to get in the game is 'Sailors Trust' which will then change any conversations you may have with sailors.

==Stuck?==

If you get stuck, try talking to some people you haven't talked to for a while. They may have something new to say to you.

For actual physical objects, each one has a use. If you're not sure what to do with it then try talking to PaulMann (but you'll have to find him first).

A lot of the solutions to problems are quite bizarre. There are further hints within the game, so read each page in full. 

==Continuity==

Do not expect too much plot continuity between this game and RestlessWorld.

Smaller than [[Orcs]] but just as disgusting, [[Goblins]] are crude humanoids that are found causing trouble in many lands. They are ugly, brown-skinned beings, about a metre and a half tall, typically dressed in ragged furs, hides and scraps of armour. [[Goblins]] are evil creatures who delight in enslaving, torturing and killing [[human humans]], [[Dwarfs]] and [[Elves]]. Some still dwell in primitive villages in the wilderness, but most now serve alongside [[Orcs]], [[Ogres]] and [[Trolls]] in the inhuman armies of Chaos. Like most of their cousins they prefer to live underground, away from sunlight which annoys them with its brightness.

[[Goblins]] are typically armed with swords, small axes or throwing-daggers. They also like making cruel traps for unwary creatures to stumble into. These can include deep pits full of poison-tipped spikes, barbed man-traps and a number of other nasty devices. Each tribe of [[Goblins]] will be led by a stronger warrior at the front of any attack.

Marsh [[Goblins]] are similar to common [[Goblins]], but with a few notable differences. They are thinner, with green-tinted, almost scaly skins, and their hands and feet are webbed for swimming. They spend most of their time skulking in the mud and reeds of their swampland homes. Marsh [[Goblins]] like [[human humans]] even less than their land-based relatives do, and they delight, for example, in typing a captive to a board and leaving him for giant leeches to drain slowly of blood...

"From a distance it could be a large lizard, two metres from snout to tail, and coloured a mottled sandy-brown. Those innocent or foolish adventurers who want to get closer will notice that the creature's head is rather bird-like and is tilted from to side to side as it tentatively sniffs the air. For one brief moment, they may take in the fact that its eyes are large and yellow, almost like a frog's, before the gaze of the Basilisk turns them to stone.

These legendary beasts kill by catching the gaze of their victim and petrifying them. An opponent needs to [be extremely lucky] in order to cover his eyes in time and avert his gaze. Attacking the creature by slashing a weapon at it without looking is just as perilous, for its poisonous breath will kill instantly! However, a Basilisk's gaze is as harmful to itself as it is to other living things. Should it catch sight of its eyes in a mirror or some other reflective device, it will turn itself to stone, hardening from living flesh to dead rock in an instant

Habitat: Deserts, plains, ruins"

[[CategoryCreatures List of all creatures]]

"The Cockatrice is a rare mythological beast much feared by even the bravest hero. Also known as the King of Serpents in some lands, it is a curious amalgam of a number of different creatures. It has the head and body of a large cockerel, the large leathery wings of a bat, and a long, snake-like tail. It can fly short distances, but will usually strut about on the ground flapping its wings. It is carnivorous, and will fearlessly attack any large creature it encounters.

In an attack a Cockatrice will attempt to peck with its beak... However, the beast also has poisonous breath, which will paralyse anything it comes into contact with. If the Cockatrice hits with its beak, damage is normally dependent on a 2D6 die roll, or a 1 in 12 chance of:

Hit in the brain - instant death
Hit on sword-arm - must use other arm to attack. Lose skill
Hit on back - difficult to move. Lose skill
Hit on left leg - can only limp. Lose skill
Hit on second-arm - cannot use arm. Lose minor skill point
No penalty
Hit in eye - 3D vision gone. Lose skill
Hit on right leg - can only limp. Lose skill
Hit on both legs - cannot move. Lose skill
Hit on both arms - cannot use arms to fight, carry items etc...
Hit in heart - instant death

Anyone caught by the Cockatrice's breath has a chance of dodging the worst of it [if they are lucky]. Like the Basilisk, to which it is distantly related, the Cockatrice has a major weakness. If it catches sight of its reflection in a mirror or some other reflective surface it will die. Persuading a hungry Cockatrice to stop and look into a mirror requires [the adventurer to be very lucky indeed]. If he fails, the Cockatrice may decide to attack while he is occupied, scoring an *automatic hit*. No one is sure why the thing can be killed in this way, but this knowledge has proved useful to a number of lucky adventurers throughout the years"

Not exactly what NetHack seems to have in mind when it talks about Cockatrices, but there you go....

Perched in towers hidden in the desert wastelands, the Hamakei are the last remnants of a past, more sorcerous age. Centuries old, these brittle, withered humanoids have vulture-like heads, and are usually swathed in masses of fine robes. They are warlocks and sages, kept alive well beyond their normal span by arcane spells and magical artefacts. Their powers are wide, gleaned from decades of research in forgotten libraries, but they use them only rarely. The Hamakei see themselves as scholars and observers, and will rarely be drawn into the petty conflicts of mortal men. Their lust is only for knowledge, and their advice can sometimes be traded for an old scroll or ancient device.

As crotchety as an ancient owl, they can be extremely temperamental and absent-minded, but will swiftly turn from doddering fool to wily fox at the mention of lost knowledge. Occasionally a Hamakei will set out into the world of men, wandering from settlement to settlement in search of any snippet it can overhear. Some are interested in the progress of this younger age and will seek out human sorcerers, to see how much of the lost arts they have rediscovered.

If encountered away from its home, a Hamakei will be dressed in inconspicuous travelling-clothes, and will lean on a long staff to help it along. The staff will usually be magical and may have spells bound into it. In the event of a drirect attack, a Hamakei can call upon many spells to ward off attackers, including magical dusts that blind or charm an opponent, and jets and walls of flame and ice. If such attacks fail to repel an aggressor, it will be forced to use its staff to defend itself as best it can.

Their towers will usually be defended by a host of magical traps, to keep intruders away. Their treasure-hoards will be large, consisting for the most part of hundreds of unintelligible and very, very ancient books, scrolls and papers, with a few strange artefacts scattered among them. Any sage worth his salt would pay dearly for even a glimpse of such treasures, though they may appear all but worthless to an adventurer.

[[Universe The Universe]] is a kind of very spacious attic that contains almost everything that we can see, hear and touch. There are only a few special exemptions from [[Universe the universe]], awarded to things that like to operate outside the normal boundaries of space and time. These include the LochNessMonster, the AbominableSnowman, socks and TheSofa

----

[[Universe The Universe]] is far too large to comprehend, at least not without a deft analogy.

Imagine that your big toe is the size of the planet [[Earth]]. Now imagine that the rest of you is scaled-up proportionately, otherwise you would look a bit silly.

You decide to order a trowel to tidy up your back garden, but unfortunately the mail order company makes trowels that are 10,000 times too big for you. They have also misjudged the demand for their trowels, and now their warehouse contains an unsold trowel for every human that has ever lived.

But that's not all. Outside the warehouse there is a statue of the Unknown Gardener, one of the many millions who died in the gamma quadrant's Gardening Wars. The statue stands one million times taller than the warehouse.

But the statue is merely a pawn on an interstellar chessboard made up of 3.2 billion squares. And the chessboard is just one of many intricately carved chessboards lying at the back of a dusty market stall so huge that even a Tesco Extra looks puny in comparison. Thousands of these market stalls gather along the route to the nearby tourist trap, which itself is just one item on the itinerary for an endless line of intergalactic holiday coaches.

Still with us? Now consider this: the universe is large enough to contain a gazillion squillion zillion of these intergalactic coach tours. And not one of the hotels they stop at will look like it did in the brochure.

[[CategoryBeers See other beers.]]

==Lager==

//Note: The below was shamelessly stolen from the [[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lager Wikipedia entry from Lager]].//

Lagers are brewed principally from malted barley (without cane sugar, an adjunct), hops and water at low temperatures (usually between 5C and 15C) that cause bottom-fermentation. The yeast ferments at these cool temperatures, and flocculates to the bottom of the vat. After fermentation they are then stored in refrigerated cellars for lagering (maturing and clarification). Lagers are stored at a low temperature (as low as 0C / 32F) for several weeks to several months, clearing, acquiring mellowness, and becoming charged with carbon dioxide. Many popular beers are lagers.

Popular brands of lager (in the UK)

	* [[CarlsbergExport Carlsberg]]: Danish.
	* [[Heineken]]: Dutch.
	* [[Carling]]: English.
	* [[StellaArtois]]: Belgian.
	* [[TigerBeer]]: Singaporean.

==LagerFans==

~-AlecRichardson is a big lager fan; he //tries// to drink real ale, but in the end he likes it fizzy and cold.
~-JonAtkinson doesn't touch anything but lager. RealAle is for BeerSnobs.

===Heineken===

Heineken is sold in more countries than any other beer in the world (including Budweiser). If you happen to visit Amsterdam, a trip to the brewery is definitely in order. For five euros you can tour the Heineken Experience, a mock-up brewery tour complete with brew kettles and bottling lines and of course, Heineken beer. There's even a ride that simulates how a bottle might feel going down the bottling line. It's great.

Heineken Lager is light golden in color, highly carbonated and produces a large foamy head. A crisp, refreshing lager perfect for summer quenching.

[[StellaArtois]] is a Belgian beer, usually around 6.5%. It has a very strong flavour, and it's quite fizzy. It also takes quite a while to settle. It is often responsible for the worst type of [[HangOver hangover]], the "[[StangOver stangover]]".

==== WikiSpam on RockMonkey ====
=== WikiSpam Discussion ===

=== Measures Implemented ===
The following technical measures have been implemented to help to prevent WikiSpam from occuring on RockMonkey:

~- 3rd March 2005: Historical versions of pages now carry a 'robots - noindex/nofollow' tag. WikiSpam remains profitable even if a wiki is well-maintained and tidied, because the old versions of the pages (with the spam) are still accessibile by search engines. Now, search engines have been asked to ignore these old pages. This change will take several weeks to start having an effect.

~- 3rd March 2005: Added a spam blocker which tests for the sudden addition of a large number of external links to a WikiPage, and prevents it. If this trips anybody over making a legitimate change, they should leave a note on this page. This spam blocker would prevent all of the WikiSpam we've seen on RockMonkey to date.
----
=== Pages Affected ===

None at present, but is becoming an increasing problem.
----
=== WikiSpam Cleaning ===
How to help in the fight against spam on our wiki:

~- Check the RecentChanges page regularly, and if you find spam, act!
~- WikiSpam typically looks like a long series of off-site word links, usually at the bottom of a page, but can take other forms, too.
~- Change the page immediately, removing the WikiSpam. Leave a note on your edit (in the small text box at the bottom of the edit page) stating that you "removed WikiSpam" (this means that people using the RecentChanges list won't feel the need to look at a page that hasn't actually been changed, and helps us keep track of how bad the problem becomes).
~- If you find WikiSpam that for some reason you can't change (no time, wierd permissions, etc.), edit this page and put the name of the affected page in the Pages Affected list, above.

Dictionary.com offers one defintion of [[Bureaucracy bureaucracy]] as //"An administrative system in which the need or inclination to follow rigid or complex procedures impedes effective action."//

RestlessBoy feels that [[Bureaucracy bureaucracy]] is one of the biggest inadvertant evils in the [[World world]] today, for these reasons:
~- It impedes [[Progress progress]] and gives power to people who want to get their way by bullying or boring others into submission. Or by making it too complicated for them to work against the system to better their own individual situation. This is often unintentional which makes it worse.
~- It values systems above individual judgement. 
~- It seeks to protect the wider public from potential flaws or errors of those in power but at the same time constrains those in power from making dynamic or innovative decisions with any speed, or sometimes entirely.
~- The very individuals who make the rules can more often than not hold up their hands and say 'There's nothing I can do, those are the rules'.
~- People spend ages making up the rules, often allowing things to pass them by. They invariably later find the rules to be deficient in some way.
~- It allows individual cases of suffering caused by the rules to be written off as [[Statistics statistics]]. 
~- In terms of government bureaucracy, entire groups of people can be left suffering whilst huge groups of CivilServants/[[Bureaucrats]] discuss what can be done about their plight.

An alternative is to elect people who are trustworthy, adept, knowledgable, and with the right priorities to a positions of power. Make sure their actions are open to scrutiny and that they can legally and personally be held accountable for their consequences. Then let them get it on with it. 

The fact that [[Idiots TheGeneralPublic]] has lost faith in this idea is what allows [[Bureaucracy bureaucracy]] to thrive and perpepuates further shitness. Because [[Bureaucracy bureaucracy]] is given a human face means [[Wankers TheGeneralPublic]] can ascribe blame to that person for the results of [[Bureaucracy bureaucracy]]'s endeavour. This leads them to further believe that it is the person, not the system, that is at fault and call for further systems. 

//"[[Capitalism]] doesn't work, [[Communism]] doesn't work, what we need is socialism under a benevolent dictator. Like SantaClaus."//

People who value systems over people should not be allowed to make decisions which affect people's lives. (see also TheWarOnTerror)

Elves walked the lands while [[Human humans]] still lived in caves and trees, for they are a very ancient race. These tall humanoids live about twice as long as humans, whom they tend to look down on as children. All elves are thin beings, with large ears and slanting eyes. They seem more graceful than [[Human humans]], and far more intelligent somehow. They are fearless warriors, particularly expert with longbows. There are a number of different Elven races, each sharing a common heritage, but very different from the others.

Black elves were originally renegades from the evil kingdoms of the Dark Elves, to whom they are related. They abandoned the forests with them, and helped build their underground kingdoms, but grew more and more horrified as the dark elves dabbled in fearful magic and demonism. So they fled the cavern cities and setlled in isolated areas away from other elven races, where they now live squalid lives alongside [[Orcs orcs]], [[Goblins goblins]] and other inhuman races. Like all elves they are tall and thin. Their skin is somewhere between grey and black in colour, their slanted eyes yellow and catlike. They dress in shabby clothes of outlandish design, and sometimes decorate themselves in a similar fashion, with bizarrely cropped hair and painted patterns on their faces. Their favourite weapons are longbows, but they have also become skilled with spears and curved swords. Some black elves are nomads, travelling the plains in caravans to trade their wares in isolated settlements. Others live in small villages themselves, hunting and farming on the ppor land. All black elves are distrustful of other beings. They will attack other types of elves on sight, but other beings will be treated neutrally, if not in a friendly way. They have no love for strangers, and are not averse to waylaying them for gold.

In the times before the rise of human civilization, the different elven races went their separate ways across the world. The taint of evil had split them into two factions. In the wars that followed, the side of good won, however, and their opponents were forced to retreat beneath the earth, leaving the forests to the Wood Elves. In time all memory of these evil tribes was forgotten. In the darkness of their subterranean world, though, the dark elves grew strong again, and their civilization developed. Over the centuries their physical form changed, and they became very thin and gaunt, with midnight-black skin and green eyes. Their mind developed too, and they became more and more evil. Their sorcerers began to rule them, and their culture became decadent with slaves, demon worship and grisly magical rituals, for they had perverted the ancient elven magic to their own ends. They have an inbuilt hatred of all surface-dwellers, and small bands of dark elves continue to raid isolated aras, burning and looting whatever they find. When on the surface they shield themselves under large, black, hooded cloaks. Below ground, however, dark elves look very different, dressing in bizarre ornate clothes and decorating their hair and bodies with strange patterns and colours. Their favourite weapons are still bows, though in the confines below they prefer long serrated knives, fashioned in strange metals and with powerful mkagic bound into them in jagged ancient runes. Despite their hatred of the surface world, the dark elves know they could never return to live there. But their hatred continues unabated, and their raiding parties will always stalk the [[Earth earth]], killing or abducting any they meet.

Not all good elves dwell in the lowland forests. Higher up, on the hills and mountainsides, Mountain Elves hunt in the snowy evergreen forests. They look very similar to wood elves, though they are shorter and not quite so thin. They dress in warm hides and furs, typically brown or white, and carry bows and long hunting-knives. They are excellent shots, and can hit any target 5 times in 6. They live off deer, rabbits and other woodland creatures, though they are careful to take only what they need. Mountain elves make their homes in small huts perched high up in trees, which offer protection from the ravages of snow wolves and other dangerous predators. Mountain delves are peaceful, rather shy beings, who do not concern themselves with the affairs of the younger races. They are wary of strangers, but will be helpful if treated with respect. If they are attacked, they will not hesitate to kill their opponents with a deadly volley of arrows.

The most common of all the elven races are the Wood Elves, who may be encountered in any large forest. They are friendly, peaceful beings who love nature and spend much of their time caring for plants, trees and the other denizens of the forests. They don't much care for [[Dwarfs dwarfs]], because they are unable to understand how they can shut themselves away from the beautiful surface world. Wood elves loathe [[Orcs orcs]], [[Trolls trolls]] and the other inhuman races for their ugliness and their insistence on burning down forests and murdering innocent creatures out of hand. As far as [[Human humans]] are concerned, they are undecided. They know that some are their allies in fighting the forces of evil, while others are in league with the [[orcs]] and their foul ilk. If adventurers are friendly and respectful, wood elves will give them all the help they need. If they prove violent and destructive, they will not be allowed to take another step into the elves' domain. Wood elves prefer to dress in soft green clothes which allow them to blend with their overgrown surroundings. They are skilled in all the woodland crafts, and can track their prey in complete silence until they wish to strike. They are superb bowmen, hitting 5 times in every 6. In combat they will also use shortswords to great effect. They dwell in large hidden villages protected both by overgrown vegetation and powerful magic. The wood elves ensure that only those they trust can find their villages. All others who seek them will become lost and wander around without ever getting near them. In their villages the elves are ruled over by proud nobles, both great warriors and spell-casters, who rule fairly and justly over all the creatures of the forest.

MicrosoftNotePad is an ASCII text editor that comes packaged with MicrosoftWindows. It's only notable 'special' feature is an integrated search tool, which pretty much everything has anyway. It can handle only DOS-formatted [[UnixLineBreaks line breaks]].

It's useful only if you happen to be using a Windows box and the phone rings and you need something close to hand to take notes in. That's about it.

PaulMann would like to add it's one of the few well designed applications which comes with MicrosoftWindows. It has a tiny memory footprint, and it loads incredibly fast.. I didn't advocate it until the later versions where they removed the 64K file limit. Now my only complaint is that it doesn't properly support linebreaks which lack the CR-byte (Windows uses CR/LF, *nix and AmigaOS use LF only, MacOS uses CR only. From a purely technical point of view, you should probably be using just CR, since LF doesn't have a physical-meaning unless you're printing)

Something HalCruttenden knows not quite enough about.
