William Henry Gates III, KBE, (born October 28, 1955), commonly known as Bill Gates, is the co-founder and current Chairman and ChiefSoftwareArchitect of MicrosoftCorporation. According to Forbes magazine in 2004, BillGates is the wealthiest person in the world, a position he has held steadily for many years.

Bill Gates was born in Seattle, Washington to William H. Gates, Sr., a corporate lawyer, and Mary Maxwell Gates, board member of First Interstate Bank, Pacific Northwest Bell and the national board of United Way. Gates went to Lakeside School, Seattle's most exclusive prep school, and later on went to study at Harvard University, but dropped out without graduating.

While he was a student at HarvardUniversity, he co-authored with Paul Allen the original Altair BASIC interpreter for the Altair 8800 (the first commercially successful personal computer) in the mid 1970s. It was inspired by BASIC, an easy-to-learn ProgrammingLanguage developed at Dartmouth College for teaching purposes.

Gates married Melinda French on January 1, 1994. They have three children, Jennifer Katharine Gates (1996), Rory John Gates (1999) and Phoebe Adele Gates (2002). They live in a very large earth-sheltered home in the side of a hill overlooking Lake Washington. It is a very modern 21st century house in the "Pacific lodge" style, with advanced electrical and electronic systems everywhere. In one respect though it is more like an 18th or 19th century mansion: It has a large private library with a domed reading room.

Also in 1994, he acquired the Codex Leicester, a collection of writings by LeonardoDaVinci; as of 2003 it was on display at the Seattle Art Museum.

In 1997, Gates was the victim of a bizarre extortion plot by Chicago resident Adam Quinn Pletcher. Gates testified at the subsequent trial. Pletcher was convicted and sentenced in July 1998 to six years in prison.

The OpenOffice was the brain-child of Erick van der Mothball, Professor of Applied Prevarication at UWA, famous for his experiments with chocolate teapots.

He reasoned that, if you could find a place full of clever innovative people and build your office there, the clever innovative people would be unable to resist correcting your mistakes. He further reasoned that, if you made it easy for these people to get into your office, they would have a higher chance of noticing your mistakes.

Carrying this logic to its extreme, he put his desk in the middle of a particularly busy corridor.

The experiment fell flat on its face when all his expensive computer equipment vanished mysteriously. To quote the only person in the area at the time, one JonAtkinson:

"It's really wierd. One minute it was all there, the next time I looked it was gone. Incidentally, do you want to buy a second-hand computer? I've just got a new one."

Rules :- 

~-Don't cite anything you can't prove (you don't have to link to proof, but be prepared to back it up...).
~-Don't be personal
~-Don't belittle an OS based on something which no longer affects it (eg Windows being unstable because of DOS, or almost total lack of hardware support in Linux. The former is now untrue, and the latter is almost completetly eradicated)
~-Assume Windows XP, and popular [[Distributions distributions]] such as [[Fedora]], [[Mandrake]] and [[Ubuntu]], due to their widespread usage. Do not cite Windows 9x, NT or 2000, or "business" distributions such as [[SuSe]] or [[Debian]]. This article is strictly about modern home users

Arguments in favour of Windows:

~- No RichardStallman

~- It's more compatible for popular software due to it's..er.. popularity

~- It's interface is much better known, so there is practically no learning curve, even for people who haven't used computers before (once you get around the hardware jump, that is)

Arguments in favour of Linux:

~- No BillGates or SteveBallmer

~- You get far less people saying "Can you fix my computer for me?" when you answer "No, I've not used Windows in 8 years". Which is //so// nice :-)

~- It's free

~- It's OpenSource, so if you don't like the way something is done, or if it doesn't support something you want to do, change it!

~- Most viruses and such like don't tend to attack [[Linux]] systems. This may be because not nearly as many people use it (so it's not worth the time writing one), or because of it's distribution methods, fixes can be sent out within hours

Warning :- Biased

Part of a much bigger concern known as TrustedComputing, but I'm putting the main article here because I like the name of the MicrosoftWindows segment (now known as NGSCB)

Trusted Computing. Sounds innocent. It's not. It's a conspiracy designed to ensure you never have full control of your computer again.

What is it? Ask an official and they'll probably fob you off with something about how it enables you to experience a whole new wealth of multimedia. Wrong. We already have access to as much as we want. Restricting our access isn't going to make it any easier

Some stages of Trusted Computing have already come into effect. The ultimate aim is to provide an encrypted "service" from all levels. From the file you download right through to the circuit board. And it seems to be working. WindowsXP and Windows 2000 (Service Pack 3 (I think) onwards) come with [[DRM]] services built in.

Now, this is all very well. You don't have to use it. You can always make your own, unencrypted digital copies. For now at least. They're trying to discourage that by issuing ProtectedMusicCds. Should you have to pay again? No, but they'd like you to

What about this you may have heard about self-deleting documents which can now be produced by MicrosoftOffice? The ability to create no paper-trail is a scary concept, and will probably just encourage to be even more reckless and carefree than they already are. Send a nasty email and have it remove all the evidence for you! As if MicrosoftWord documents keeping previous versions wasn't bad enough...

It gets worse. There are plans to issue [[OperatingSystem Operating Systems]] which are themselves "secure". They will negotiate with the host PC and will not even boot if the environment doesn't match what they were expecting. Sound far fetched? Well... what do you think the WindowsXP activation is for? You change your hardware, you have to re-register. Whoopeee

It gets worse. Again. There are plans to make applications follow the same steps (Indeed, MicrosoftOffice does). If this continues, it will just about kill [[Shareware shareware]], OpenSource software, and indeed OpenSource [[OperatingSystem Operating Systems]] as we know them. Of course, this can't happen without support from the hardware manufacturers. Shame [[Intel]] are already a part of the [[TCPA]] isn't it?

It may sound far fetched, and it may sound as though I'm exaggerating here, but we aren't that far off. The [[TCPA]] has already formed, ideas have been discussed and some have already been implemented. We've proved time and time again that ideas like [[CSS]], [[DRM]] and ProductActivation can be circumvented, but if they do this on a hardware level, we won't even be able to run the tools needed to circumvent them! We are already "advised" by Microsoft that we shouldn't install drivers that haven't been "cerfified" by them (By this, of course, they mean that the manufacturers didn't pay them large sums of money to slap a "Designed for Windows XP" sticker on their product). Some implementations question any programs you try and run which aren't recognised. How long before they just say no?

How long before you do?

See also [[DRM]], [[DMCA]]

==== [[RockCandy Rock (Candy)]] ====

//Not to be confused with [[Rock Rock (Not Candy)]], or you're (more) likely to break your teeth, unless you're a [[Giants giant]].//

[[RockCandy Rock]] is a type of candy, traditionally made in [[Blackpool]].

====How Rock Is Made====

//(note: taken from [[http://www.coronationrock.co.uk/ www.coronationrock.co.uk]] - not yet edited)//

===Mixing & Boiling===

Firstly we mix sugar and glucose syrup and using gas fires boil the mixture in large copper pans to a temperature of 150 centigrade. The mixture, called a boiling, is held at this temperature until most of the water content is driven off as steam.

===Pouring & Cooling===

The boiling is then poured out onto cold steel tables through which water is circulated to help the product to cool.

===Colouring and Flavouring===

Colours and flavours are added to the boiling to match those ordered.

===Lettering===

As the boiling cools it has plasticene like texture which enables our experts to build letters and logos using strips of colored toffee.

===Completing the Boiling===

The letters and the outer case are all wrapped around a central core to make one huge piece of rock... weighing around 60 Kgs.

===Pulling===

This large piece is now pulled out by hand to the thickness ordered. The thickness of the bars is constantly monitored so that all the finished bars will be the correct size and weight.

===Rolling===

...then is rolled on long tables. At this point each bar is around six metres long. There is still some heat in the bars, so they are still pliable. Much care needs to be taken to keep the rock straight.

===Cooling & Cutting===

As the rock is rolled it cools and becomes hard and brittle and is eventually cut to the length ordered using special cutters.

===Packing & Dispatch===

Finally the rock is labelled and wrapped in cellothane. It is then packed securely for transport to our customers all over the world or taken straight to [[Blackpool]] shops when it is sometimes still warm when put out on the shelves.

===The Final Result===

And here is the final result, exactly what you see when you bite into our rock candy. We sell the freshest rock in town!

The fearsome black-and-red SearchEngine was one of the principal characters in Thomas the Tank Engine: The Sodor Massacres, a series written by a channel 5 development team which tragically never saw daylight.

In it, an army of evil trains led by SearchEngine took over the island, forcing Thomas and the other survivors to live underground, with only a troop of semi-naked, nymphomanic [[Lesbians]] to bring them the supplies they needed.

SearchEngine himself had a laser-guided flamethrower on his back, along with razor-sharp cutting blades extending, Boadiccea style, from his wheels.

The series was pulled in the end so that 5 could make the more crowd-pleasing Sister Act III: The [[Lesbian]] Years, and the SearchEngine action figures, of which none were ever made, are now highly collectible.

[[WikiGames Other games]]

'Yours' is a fun game to play with people in the street.

The game is not particularly politically correct, nor is it a game which you can play in polite company. The game revolves around the concept of a non-existant sticker album. The object of the game is to collect ugly people and put them into your non-existant album. Rules do, however, apply:

* You can only call females, unless the person is a well-known figure, in which case males are allowed.
* You can't call anyone over the age of your own grandmother
* Or, indeed, younger than your youngest sibling (if you have none, say about 14 years old).

The method of playing the game is simple. While you're walking around, and you see an ugly (or odd, poor, homeless, chav-ish etc) person, you have to be the first person in your group of players to call that person and 'give' them to another player to put in their album. You need to call people in a certain way, however. The two phrases considered acceptable by the International Yours Foundation include:

* "Yours!"
* "That one's yours, mate."

Other local variations apply (we at the International Yours Foundation would like to see a localised Welsh version, for example), but in competition these are currently the only acceptable means of assigning points.

The game is scored in a fairly loose manner. The person who is currently 'winning' is often the person who called the most recent ugly person. In other situations, the leader is the person who has called the most ugly people that day. In situations where all players spot the same person at the same time, it is the person who manages to shout the phrase fastest or loudest who takes the lead. Bonus points can be gained by calling the person from within earshot; if you can manage to call a person from right next to them, you take the lead. This, of course, runs the risk of the other players spotting that person first. This can lead to exciting games where reflexes are the key.

Now, for some examples.

{{image url="http://www.fatchicksinpartyhats.com/images/fathat35.jpg"}}

This one is yours. Note the overweight nature of this beast, along with the terrible clothes and badly chosen glasses.

{{image url="http://www.riftweak.com/files/OH%20MY%20GOD%20UGLY%20GOTH!!!.jpg"}}

This one is also yours. In this case, she is both ugly, fat, AND odd. This monster scored highly.

{{image url="http://www.sr.bham.ac.uk/~jpfo/photos/chavstock/chav_010-r.jpg"}}

This foul stain also scored well. Burberry gains extra points, as due to the aggressive nature of the chav, calling one in it's natural habital (pictured here at the watering hole) can result in fisticuffs.

{{image url="http://www.fatchicksinpartyhats.com/images/fathat227.jpg"}}

This is an example as a male yours. Prescott scores big points due to his fame and aggressive northern boorishness. Calling Prescott in the street would very probably promote you to the current 'winner'. 

{{image url="http://www.beerandspeech.org/images/041019/chav.jpg"}}

This would be a stunning call. Note the gold chains, excessive make-up and clear social deprivation.

{{image url="http://i.somethingawful.com/cliff/ihateyou/page-263/image-06.jpg"}}

One of these ladies is 'yours', one is not. Can you guess which?

==== TromaNight ====
=== About TromaNight ===

TromaNight is a night of the week (usually Saturday) when a group of like-minded friends get together at [[DanHuntley Dan]] and [[ClaireMelton Claire]]'s flat to watch films. Sometimes they're [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/AwfulFilms AwfulFilms]], sometimes they're [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/GoodFilms GoodFilms]], and just as often they're [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/MediocreFilms MediocreFilms]].

The night was named after our love for films by TromaStudios, which are almost all [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/AwfulFilms AwfulFilms]].

People drink RealAle by default, though some (like JonAtkinson) drink ColdLager. Sometimes people smoke JazzCigarettes.

It's fun.

::Edit - TromaStudios now also seem to be aware of it's existence, which could get interesting....::

=== TromaNightAdventure ===

DanHuntley is currently working on an advanced [[WikiGames WikiGame]] on the RockMonkey server, called TromaNightAdventure. This takes advantage of the WikiGameToolkit to provide an enhanced online adventure game experience.

Knowing a little bit about TromaNight //might// help you in the adventure. If you need help, consult [[http://www.tromanight.co.uk/ the TromaNight web site]].

Diplomacy is a [[CategoryBoardGames board game]] which features no luck, and seven players. Each player represents one of the seven Great Powers present in Europe prior to the Great War. 

The players attempt to win the game by controlling 18 or more of the supply depots on the map at the end of their turn. This cannot be achieved without the help of other players. Nor can it be achieved without stabbing other players in the back. 

How clever is that?!

The trick, apparently, is knowing when to make a deal, and when to break it. And knowing whom you may trust, of course. Currently, an online version is being played out amongst several of the GeekNight regulars. Bearing in mind the trick (see above) it's likely to be a fairly interesting mix of trust, betrayal and blind, indignant fury.

====The Police Station====

You enter the station to see Chief Inspector Blancheflower's face is white and feary. 

"Restless, I don't know what's happened. Every goshdarn man on the Police Force has been struck down with a mysterious illness. I'm not feeling so good myself. How are you feeling?"

"I'm fine," you say.

"Good. Because I suspect foul play is afoot."

"Yes, I heard about that duck. It can't be real can it?"

"Never mind the duck. All this mysteriousness smacks of Zanatoth's doing..."

"But how? I defeated Zanatoth only a month or two ago."

"I know and his corspe was coated in plastic and sealed into lead box at the bottom of the sea where it's guarded by police sharks, with guns. Yet still, I can't help but wonder..."

The phone rings. Chief Inspector Blancheflower answers it and looks concerned. 

"What? That fucking idiot!" he slams the phone down and turns to you. "That was a call from PeterHain's office. The SceptreOfZanatoth has been stolen."

"What? Wasn't that destroyed."

"We thought so. It seems our beloved SecretaryOfState was keeping it in his home and using it as a paperweight, the tit." Chief Inspector Blancheflower suddenly vomits all over his desk. Ugh!

"Restless, you need to find out what's going on around here. I'm too ill to help. I'm gonna go home and drink Ovaltine. You're on your own Restless."

[[SOZ001 Start your mission!]]

Techinically speaking the world doesn't have a "west" bit to it- there is no west pole, you just keep on going round and round. The term dates back to when the [[European]] nations were expanding ever outwards, and they still thought the world was flat, with them at the western-most edge, and [[Asia]] towards the eastern-most edge. With the discovery of the [[America Americas]], the [[European]] explorers and wise men decided the world was in fact round, but the "East" and "West" were so engrained into people's minds that they stayed there, and we still use them today.

When people say "the [[WesternWorld Western World ]]" they tend to mean the rich part of it. Although [[Africa]] and [[CentralAmerica Central ]] and [[SouthernAmerica Southern]] [[America]] are in the west, people most often group them into the "developing countries" camp.

This is a page to discuss which is better [[Cats]] or [[Dogs]]

When you have considered the points, you can vote [[DogsVsCatsTheVote here]]
----
**Reasons [[Cats]] are superior**
{{image class="right" alt="A cat today" url="http://www.mycathatesyou.com/images/site/britneydark2.jpg"}}
~- When you're in a bad mood, they don't try to cheer you up - DanHuntley.
~- They smell less awful - DanHuntley. (not true, my dad's [[Cats Cat]] Harry farts like a human being after a big curry - RestlessBoy)
~- In almost every case, they're more than capable of fending for themselves, should an emergency arise that requires them to.
~- They're so efficient they can get away with sleeping for two thirds of their life.
~- They come before [[Dogs]] in the alphabet.
~- They're not stupid enough to be whipped into pulling a sledge through snow.
~- Cats purr. 
~- Cats rub your leg when they want affection, not when they're horny.
~- Cats use a litter box. Dogs use your leg.
~- Cats always land on their feet.
~- Cats look cute sleeping on the TV. Dogs just crash right in front of the screen.
~- Fewer cat owners suffer from 'Flappy Tail' lacerations than dog owners.
~- No one has ever had to "Beware of the Cat".
~- They're independent. If you forget to feed them they'll do fine.

----
**Reasons [[Cats]] are inferior**
{{image class="right" alt="Another cat today" url="http://jovan.ru/pics2/kittens/ugly%20kitten.jpg"}}
~- You can't take them for walks (I used to take our cats for walks most days - [[DanHuntley Dan]]:: I suspect your cats were exceptional. Did they start dancing round with excitement and miaowing with excitement when you told them they were going? - [[RestlessBoy RB]])
~- [[Cats]] will not show you affection unless it suits them, sometimes a [[Cats Cat]] will be deeply loved by its owner and seemingly despise them in return. It's my theory that this means people who prefer [[Cats]] secretly hate themselves, believe themselves undeserving of love and therefore choose a pet that reflects this. (Of course any attempt to attribute feelings of 'love' to a [[Cats Cat]] //or// [[Dogs Dog]] is an illusion you project onto their behaviour anyway. They don't love you, you just interpret their behaviour as meaning they do. Which only furthers my reasoning that people who choose cats hate themselves.) - RestlessBoy.
~- They hang around with witches
~- People give them pretentious names like 'Desdemona', 'Mistopheles', and 'Chesterton'.
~- When you're in a bad mood, they don't try to cheer you up - RestlessBoy
~- They just wander off and get run over and die and you never find out what's happened to them
~- When [[MrsSloakham a woman]] strokes her [[Cats cat]] it can be a source of tedious innuendo
~- They're independent - they don't need you. You're just a convenient source of warmth and food.

The current GuineaPigStrike, which is causing the world-wide shortage of MiltonSirotta, is a mere ripple effect of the 1983 Guinea Pig Labour Act. This was the act in which MargaretThatcher decreed that all Guinea Pigs that were not, in fact, from Guinea (except if they were first generation immigrants) should be worked in accordance to the BritishPigLaws, which lead to lower pay, longer hours, and little tiny rashers of bacon.

Now GuineaPigs are a gentle race, and it has taken them over two decades to get suitably worked up about the matter for them to take the radical step of a general strike. This strike means that no more milk would be produced until the little fuzzy workers were promised more pay, shorter hours, the option of FlexiTime, and the banning of the wanton slaughter of their race for the lucrative mini-bacon trade.

==== BadPages ====

[[DanHuntley Dan]]'s a big fan of good wiki etiquette, and so these pages are dedicated to helping people better undertand how to make this wiki better for all of us. Here's a list of some of the things that make BadPages bad:

== This document is under construction. There's more to come. ==

=== 1. [[BadPagesNoLinks No Links To Other Pages]] ===
Every WikiPage should have at least one, and ideally more, links (or potential links) to related [[WikiPage WikiPages]]. In order to help facilitate this, I've composed a [[BadPagesNoLinks list of pages that violate this principle]].

Plenty of cross-linking ensures a vibrant and exciting wiki community, which people can explore for hours without getting stuck 'in a loop' or reaching a DeadEnd.

=== 2. [[BadPagesNoContent No Content]] ===
A WikiPage which is completely blank is even worse than one that has never been defined - it doesn't appear in the WantedPages list. It's surprisingly common to see people deliberately 'blank' pages if they disagree with their content, even though that content can just be 'rolled back' using the 'History' link - far better to provide counter-arguments and update the content you don't appreciate. Here's a I've composed a [[BadPagesNoContent list of pages that violate this principle]].

=== 3. OrphanedPages ===
We currently have a problem with orphaned pages (those which are not linked to from anywhere else on the wiki) and subclouds (sections of the wiki not connected to the "BigCloud"). We're [[OrphanedPagesProblem debating solutions to the OrphanedPagesProblem]].

----
See also:
~- [[BadPagesNoLinks Bad pages with no links to other pages]]
~- [[BadPagesNoContent Bad pages with no content at all]]

==== The BigCloud ====

The BigCloud is a metaphor for all the pages in a wiki which are, by some means or another, linked to one another in the large bulk of the wiki. There are several smaller clouds (usually of only two or three [[WIkiPage WikiPages]] each, linked to one another) outlying the BigCloud, and there are a reasonable number of OrphanedPages ([[WIkiPage WikiPages]] with no links to them whatsoever) on the outskirts.

The addition of the "Links Here" links on [[WIkiPage WikiPages]] and the OrphanedPages/BadPages pages were supposed to alleviate the problem of OrphanedPages, but have met with limited success. There is currently a debate on the [[OrphanedPagesProblem]] and how to solve it.

PlaidCymru - The Party of Wales

They are the Welsh Nationalist party.  They stand for an independant Wales within the European Union, social justice, economic prosperity and care for the natural environment.

They also protect and promote the Welsh language, as well as attempt to increase Wales' profile on the international stage with a view to becoming an independent member of the UnitedNations .

They currently have 3 MPs, 12 National Assembly Members and 1 MEP, all working for Wales.  Along with the SNP they are part fo the European Free Alliance Group in the EuropeanParliament.

MattPayne worked as a parliamentary researcher for them for a while in the summer and enjoyed wandering around parliament in combats and a bright yellow T-shirt.  The MPs are lovely and Simon Thomas the (former) MP for Ceredigion is a really nice up-right bloke, who cares about his (ex) job.  The others are also really friendly and particulary Adam Price MP for Camarthan East, are a good laugh.

For more info see:

This article is used to describe all portable-audio devices, since the name has become fairly [[ubiquitous]].

Descriptions follow of the three main market leaders. Not including low-spec flash-memory models, just 20Gb/40Gb hard drive models. To be as far as possible, all have broadly the same attributes, and are costed in US Dollars

====iPod (~87% market share)====
**Price:** 20Gb for $299, 40Gb for $399 (discontinued)
**Formats:** MP3, PCM Waveforms, AAC (iTunes [[DRM]]), AIFF, Audiobook, Apple Lossless
**Features:** iTunes integration, driverless usage, playlist synchronisation, song rating, text viewing (iCal and address book only (Note: 4th Generation iPod's can read any text files as long as they're in the Notes/ folder on the iPod. Supports both Unix and Window line-breaks --JonAtkinson)), games, firmware upgradeable.
**Interface:** Front buttons. Simple, yet intuitive
**Connection:** Firewire, later propietory USB2
**Cache:** ~30Mb
**Notes:** Mac only for the first 8 months. Li-Ion battery, around 12-hours, 500 recharges estimated. The only player which can play encrypted iTunes files

====Creative Zen====
**Price:** 20Gb for $2[[69]], 40Gb for $329.99
**Formats:** WMA, MP3, PCM Waveforms, Windows Media, IMA ADPCM
**Features:** FM Radio, voice recorder (built-in mic only), sync with Outlook, Address book and Calendar, EAX
**Interface:** Similar to iPod, but with a vertical strip
**Connection:** USB 2.0 or Firewire
**Cache:** Around 14-15Mb
**Notes:** 11-hours

====iRiver====
**Price:** 20Gb for $285, 40Gb for $369 (discontinued)
**Formats:** MP3, PCM Waveforms, OggVorbis, Windows Media, ASF, 
**Features:** Text viewing (any ASCII), driverless usage (no drivers to transfer files), FM radio, audio recording (with support for external mike and on the fly MP3 encoding), optical in/out, firmware upgradeable, playlist synchronisation (with drivers), WinAMP playlist support, 
**Interface:** Horrible. No. Really. Takes some getting used to.
**Connection:** Mini-USB2
**Cache:** Unknown
**Notes:** Has a reputation for providing a higher sound quality than the iPod, even with the provided earphones. However, the H-series have now been discontinued, with nothing between the 5Gb player and the 20/40Gb music/photo viewers. Li-Polymer quoted at ~16 hours playback

And just for a laugh, my old portable MP3 player before I got my iRiver (- [[PaulMann Paul]])

====mpMan ("Rio")====
**Price:** About 120 I think, for my 32Mb model (Upgradable with smartmedia card by up to 32Mb more)
**Formats:** MP3
**Features:** Umm. Playback? Had to install a driver to transfer
**Interface:** Very very simple. But it would be. It didn't do anything besides play. Don't think it even had random support
**Connection:** Parallel port
**Cache:** None needed. Solid state
**Notes:** Battery life, about 4 hours. Tops.

==== The OrphanedPagesProblem ====

The OrphanedPagesProblem was identified in the RockMonkey ChatRoom by PaulMann on the 18th May 2005. OrphanedPages are WikiPages which are not linked to by any other page on the wiki. Some extend this definition to include orphaned clusters: selections of pages which are not linked to from anywhere else in the BigCloud, but link to one another. Parts of the debate follow. Please feel free to chirp in with suggestions:

----
**PaulMann suggests a way to prevent OrphanedPages**
I have a suggestion for RockMonkey, which I'll leave here for people to peruse in the morning, or whenever. *cough*. Make it so whenever the "edit" script is accessed, the referrer is checked, and the edit page only appears correctly if it was accessed by clicking on a WikiWord, rather than typing theaddress in manually. That should greatly remove the number of OrphanedPages which seem to be appearing at a rapid rate, largely thanks to MilfordCubicle.
----
**DanHuntley picks holes in PaulMann's argument, and suggests a bad alternative**
Nice idea, but won't work with browsers that hide referrers (many installs of ZoneAlarm do this when jumping trans-site, so people only see "local" referrals), and, more importantly, won't work if user came directly to page (which is common for me, because I find out about RecentChanges by [[RSS]] andjust "jump in", and sometimes by WikiGame developers).
In addition, WikiGames may suffer, as it's very difficult or impossible to write code that will detect, for example, wiki links which only appear as a result of tokens or are full (http://...) links, so if you used one of these you'd likely be denied from changing the resulting page.

But you're right about the OrphanedPages situation, [[PaulMann Paul]]. Perhaps there's another way...
We could make it, for example, such that: "If you own more orphaned pages than anybody else, and this is more than X (3?), you may not edit pages other than orphaned pages". This will result in people having to reduce the number of orphans they're responsible for before they can do other edits, and by doing so, they become second-worst for it, making somebody else the OrphanMaster, until all active members have less than X OrphanedPages.

However, again, there's a problem as far as the linking structure is concerned. A page which only contains a link to a category page appears orphaned, but is not, and a page linked to only by WikiGame code (e.g.some of TromaNightAdventure/RestlessWorld's dead scenes) appear orphaned, but are not under the correct (tokens/items) circumstances.

Plus, an almost equally-big problem to orphaning is seperation from "The BigCloud", small clusters - usually of just two [[WIkiPage WikiPages]] - of pages that are connected to one another but to nothing else.

While not technically orphans, they contribute equally little to wiki structure.

Suggestions welcome.
----
**RuthVarley pitches in despite being only a junior grade geek**
Well, it would probably help if everybody just read this page, felt guilty, and went away to fix orphaned pages they knew they'd created in the past...
----
**DanHuntley backs up [[RuthVarley Ruth]]**
I'd love to see things work based on community-lovey-ness and respect for one another and for the wiki. But that's not likely to happen, is it. I'm never a fan of saying this, but a technical solution may actually be the best answer.

Perhaps we could make it impossible to make a page unless a link exists to it already? But we'd still have the wikigame/category problems, potentially.
----
**RestlessBoy adds his two cents**
Maybe we could just acknowledge that the whole of RockMonkey is just something a very small number of people use for pissing around having fun when they're bored and that it doesn't really matter if some pages get lost on the way, or if [[Watermelon]] links to [[Kangaroo]]. It's not like anyone really uses this as a serious info resource. The WikiGames are the biggest chunk of it volume-wise and most of the rest is just for people to take the piss (see [[Daventry]]).
----
**DanHuntley sits on the fence a little longer**
Aye, I agree with RestlessBoy. The OrphanedPages problem is not such a problem as one might expect, compared to the [[BadPagesNoLinks dead-end pages]] and the (awful) [[BadPagesNoContent content-less pages]].

[[Watermelon]] and [[Kangaroo]] are part of the BigCloud. =o)
----
**JimmyCarter adds a little aside**
Would it be possible to represent the big cloud/ little clouds in some sort of diagram, showing how many pages are in each and the connections between them? I'm thinking of those [[http://research.lumeta.com/ches/map/gallery/index.html Internet Mapping]] guys here, but obviously on a much smaller scale.

It //might// help to track and shut down the errant clusters (doesn't that sound slightly Blade Runner-ish?), but it will look nice and pretty.
----
**DanHuntley answers**
Yes, it's possible.

Yes, I'd love it to happen.

No, I don't have the time or inclination to write the program. But I'll lend all the support I can to anybody who does. Perhaps some young geek might like to have a stab at the project over the summer. Just tell me if you're interested and I'll tell you what it'll entail.
----
**RuthVarley gets all enthusiastic**
Ooh, ooh, I want to do it!

The thirty-ninth president of the UnitedStatesOfAmerica. 

Carter- full name James Earl Carter Jr.- was born on October 1, 1924, in Plains, Georgia. Son to a peanut farmer, he managed to rise from these humble beginnings and become president. He had high aspirations- he wanted to make government "compassionate and competent", and help out the people of his country any way he could.

Unfortunately he is mostly remembered for causing a recession, but he had a tough gig in regards to the economic situation at the time, and without his help [[UnitedStatesOfAmerica America]] would have come out of it a lot worse off.

His foreign policies were more progressive than others that have come before or after him. Despite rubbing the powerful [[USSR]] up the wrong way with regards to his views on human rights, he still managed to pursue nuclear limitation treaties with them, open up full diplomatic relations with [[China]], and helped the peace process in the MiddleEast by way of the Camp David agreement. On a side note, his administration was the one who trained Afghani rebels to fight the [[USSR Soviet]] invasion, including a young and eager OsamaBinLaden. But hey, everyone makes mistakes!

A lot of people remember that Iran hostage crisis that consumed the last 14 months of his term, but not many people know that he (and his administration) were the ones who finally got the US hostages free- on the day JimmyCarter walked out of office, the hostages were sent home. 

Personally I think JimmyCarter was a good man, who came to power in difficult times (both internationally and internally) and did the best he, or indeed anyone, could have done.

Water sprays out of a concealed opening behind her head, forming a crown of moving water. It then falls through a series of channels, running into a clear pool at the statues's feet. Moving closer, you see nothing of any interest.

===== DanHuntley =====

==== About DanHuntley ====

DanHuntley's weblog, [[http://www.scatmania.org/ Scatmania]], contains more information about him

DanHuntley [[http://www.scatmania.org/archives/2003/09/28/growing-up/ refuses to use MSN Messenger]]

DanHuntley lives in AberWorld, a.k.a. [[AberystwythTown Aberystwyth]] He's a former [[ComputerScienceStudents Computer Science student]] of the UniversityOfWalesAberystwyth, but now he works full-time as a CodeMonkey for SmartData UK Ltd in the AberTechnium.

His full title this week is "[[DanHuntley Dan Huntley]] [[ComputerScienceGraduates BEng]] [[BritishComputerSociety MBCS]]".

DanHuntley is going out with ClaireMelton, and together they run TromaNight, Aber's best crazy alternative film night, and GeekNight, it's sister night on which attendees play unusual board games

He enjoys drinking RealAle, programming in [[PHPLanguage PHP]], [[JugglingThings juggling]], and [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/AwfulFilms AwfulFilms]]

[[DanHuntleyQuotes Read some of Dan's quotes here]]

==== Dan's Presence On RockMonkey ====

=== WikiGames and the WikiGameToolkit ===
DanHuntley made the following WikiGames:

~- WikiPlatformGame and [[EvilWikiPlatformGame1 EvilWikiPlatformGame]]: turn-based platform game fun.
~- WikiBridgePuzzle: at the time of it's development, the biggest [[WikiGames wiki game]] ever: a puzzle game.
~- TromaNightAdventure, an adventure game based on TromaNight and powered by the developmental WikiGameToolkit. **[[TromaNightAdventure Go play it!]]**
~- KnightmareWikiGame is under development, a graphical [[WikiGames WikiGame]].
~- TromaNightAdventure2 is in the planning stages of development.
~- He's also continuously developing and improving on the WikiGameToolkit, to help others write WikiGames.

=== Other Projects ===
~- He keeps an eye on the RockMonkey UsageStatistics, and reports on [[UsageStatistics the funniest ones]].
~- He made [[Rockipedia]], a rock identification tool.
~- Along with PaulMann, he does a reasonable amount of wiki maintenance, including the development of the BadPages section. He's currently working on the OrphanedPagesProblem.
~- He wrote various plugins for the wiki engine, including BadPages, the improved [[CategoryCategory category]] system, the ChatRoom engine, and parts of [[Igneous]], the ChatRoom bot.

==== WelshPeopleAgainstTromaNight ====

=== In Fiction ===

The WelshPeopleAgainstTromaNight are a fictional group featured in the TromaNightAdventure [[WikiGames WikiGame]] by DanHuntley. In the game, they kidnap RuthVarley and tie her up [[Pantycelyn]]. She must be rescued by the player in order to win the game with the highest possible score. There are two possible ways to do this, but the way which involves the player more directly is worth a greater number of points, and grants access to an otherwise unobtainable item, although it does require greater preparation and carries a greater risk.

The group also features in TromaNightAdventure2, the sequel to the aforementioned game. Their role in this has not yet been made public.

=== In Reality ===

The WelshPeopleAgainstTromaNight do not exist. They're only believed in by certain [[ConspiracyTheory conspiracy theorists]], and there is no evidence to substantiate their claims. That is all. [[Fnord]].

==== Games To Play On The RockMonkey Wiki ====

Games created on RockMonkey by people with TooMuchFreeTime.

**Finished WikiGames include:**

=== AfterTheQuake ===
Non-interactive, but still...

=== WikiMaze ===
The original RockMonkey [[WikiGames WikiGame]], now in it's second edition. Find your way around the maze, avoiding the [[Lesbians]] and [[HardCorePorn TubGirl]]! By JonAtkinson.

=== WikiPlatformGame (and [[EvilWikiPlatformGame1 EvilWikiPlatformGame]]) ===
A platform game implemented through the medium of wiki, and it's politically-incorrect sequel. By DanHuntley.

=== WikiBridgePuzzle ===
A classic puzzle, re-interpreted through the RockMonkey wiki engine. Can you get the RockMonkey people from one end of the bridge to the other without getting stuck? By DanHuntley.

=== RestlessWorld ===
Epic adventure game: explore a vast world on your journey to [[Safeway]] to retrieve the SceptreOfZanatoth... many surprises await you on your quest... can you conquer RestlessWorld? By AndyRegan/RestlessBoy.

=== TromaNightAdventure ===
Huge [[WikiGames WikiGame]] by DanHuntley - collect the items and find the people needed to save TromaNight! The first [[WikiGames WikiGame]] to make use of the WikiGameToolkit to implement [[RockMonkeySessions RockMonkey Sessions]] (a tool used to provide persistence, a simple scripting language, and sessional variables to WikiGames).

=== TheRockMonkeyChessTest ===
Find out which chessboard piece you are with this scientifically-proven test. By MisterJTA.

=== TheRevengeOfZanatoth ===
**Stunning**, much-anticipated sequel to RestlessWorld, by AndyRegan/RestlessBoy. Rescue Peter Hain and defeat Zanatoth once and for all, in this huge adventure!

=== TheOnlineGame ===
Online version of TheGame. You're out.

=== PassThePageGame ===
Just like that game you used to play when you were a kid, where you'd write a line of a story, fold over the edge of the paper, and pass it on. Orchestrated by RestlessBoy.

=== WikiScissorsStonePaper ===
A reinterpretation of the classic game, by MattInTheHat (with coding by DanHuntley).

=== CraigDavidGame ===
Good old-fashioned silliness, from AndyRegan/RestlessBoy.

The guard turns his head. He is smiling aimlessly. He glances from you to the spike-topped wall, and shakes his head in disgust. Then, abruptly, the inane grin returns. He turns away from you and resumes scratching at the wall with a broken pair of scissors.

======Western Gate======
{{SetToken token="guardGone" value="1"}}
"Freedom is what?" You ask.

The guard looks at you slowly, sizing you up. "Well, you don't look like a spy..." He seems to decide something. Tipping his helmet back, he looks straight into your eyes. You recoil from the pain there. "Freedom is being allowed to be miserable." He tells you.

You want to ask what's going on here, but before you can say anything else, the elf leans closer and speaks to you again. "I have to go now, my life is in danger. If you know what's good for you, squirrel, you'll get out of here."

With that, he's gone, tapping a section of wall and disappearing into the hole that appears.
----
What now?

[[TnS006 Leave]]
[[TnS033 Follow The Elf]]

======Secret Passage======

You try to run, but the gap in the wall has closed. As you search for it, you hear running footsteps behind you. You try to turn, but something hits you just behind the left ear and you fall unconscious.

[[TnS030 Continue]]

======Secret Passage======

"I... I tripped. Yes, that's it! Tripped and fell in here. I'll just be leaving, shall I?" You garble. The elf watches you impassively as you back away from him, through the gap in the wall and out into the blessed daylight.

The secret panel bangs shut.

[[TnS006 Continue]]

======Secret Passage======

You try to garble out an explanation, but the elf advances on you in such a menacing way that you temporarily lose the power of speech.

Turning, you flee, but the way out has shut, and before you can blast it open with the De-Squidgilator, something hits you just behind the left ear and the whole world goes black.

[[TnS030 Continue]]

======Secret Passage======

As the guard vanishes from sight, you dart forward and leap bravely through the closing gap, into the secret passage.

Inside, it is dark and clammy. You can see nothing, although you can smell old fish. It's really quite unpleasant.

You pull your Illumifier from your belt, and flick it to 'purple'. Instantly, the passage is flooded with bright green light. You make a note to fix the dial when you get home.

Some little way ahead of you, the guard turns. He has dumped the ridiculous pastel-blue sword and oversized helmet, and is now holding a thin curved knife which gleams uncannily in the green light.

"Why are you following me?" He asks, and he doesn't sound friendly.

======Prologue======
{{SetToken token="character" value="0"}}{{SetToken token="visMar" value="0"}}{{SetToken token="saltQuest" value="0"}}
It seems like an ordinary enough morning when you first open your eyes. Sweetie is sleeping peacfully by your side, and the wood is tranquil. You dig out some acorns for breakfast; there's no salt, so you go back and wake Sweetie.

"We're out of salt." 
She grunts something and goes back to sleep.
"C'mon Sweetie, I want my breakfast". You shake her.

Suddenly, there' s a loud noise. Sweetie jerks awake and sits up.
"What was that?", she asks, as if it's in any way relevant.
"I know what it wasn't." You wittily reply, "It wasn't some salt, because we've run out."
"Oh, shut up." She tells you, and scampers over to the Periloscope. Her harsh words offend you, and you sulk for a bit, until she hits you with her tail and calls out excitedly:
"We've got a call! Somewhere over to the West!"

"Will there be salt there?" You call back, but she's already pulling on her rubber mask and doesn't seem to hear you. You sigh, and go to put on your own costume. It's not easy being a super-hero when you haven't had breakfast yet.

short for 'Intelligent Dance Music' - a horrible name for cutting edge electronica which you can't dance to.

Artists referred to as [[IDM]] typically include
AphexTwin
BoardsOfCanada
[[Squarepusher]]
[[Autechre]]

An alternative name, coined by [[AphexTwin Richard D James]] is [[Braindance]].

Record labels associated with [[IDM]] are WarpRecords and [[Rephlex]]
---------------
CategoryMusicGenres

Electronica/techno label founded in the late 80s in [[Sheffield]]. ([[http://www.warprecords.com website]]) Began as a label releasing UK pressing of Detroit Techno and New York house before signing UK artists such as [[LFO]], and [[Seefeel]]. Has recently expanded to include nominally 'indie' bands such as [[Broadcast]], folk act [[Gravenhurst]], and jazz releases from filmmaker [[VincentGallo]]

Artists on [[WarpRecords Warp]] include:-
AphexTwin
BoardsOfCanada 
[[Squarepusher]] 
[[Autechre]] 
[[Prefuse73]]
JamieLidell

An excellent resource for [[WarpRecords Warp]] material is their downloads website [[http://www.bleep.com bleep.com]]

An excellent introduction to [[WarpRecords Warp]] is the [[http://www.warprecords.com/news/?offset=0&ti_id=840&filter=warp WarpVision]] DVD.
---------------
CategoryMusicCompanies

AKA Scott Herron. An artist who mixes HipHop beats with [[IDM]] stylings. Signed to [[WarpRecords Warp]]

An excellent album to check out is One Word Extinguisher.

CategoryBands

====The CraigDavidGame====

===The Rules===

==What names are allowed?==

You are only allowed to use the names of [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/CategoryFamousPeople FamousPeople]]. For example [[AndyRegan AndrewRegan]] is a suitable name (Regan being a girl's name) but he is not famous enough. [[http://www.rockmonkey.org.uk/CategoryFamousPeople FamousPeople]] can include, pop stars, footballers, TV/Film stars, writers, scientists... basically use your common sense.

As an example LukeTaylor of [[Aberystwyth]] band TheHotPuppies is not allowed, whereas StuartDavid, former bassist of chart act BelleAndSebastian is.

You cannot have MacSomethings, O'Somethings, SomethingSons or first names with an S on the end i.e. JulieAndrews - unless they can also be used as first names. i.e. HarrisonFord justifies GeorgeHarrison.

The name has to be spelled exactly - so you can't justify AinsleyHarriot because Harriet is a first name.

Pseudonyms/noms de plume/stage names are allowed - for example BobDylan. You can also use them to justify other choices. You can also use the real names of people who use pseudonyms - meaning you can have both EltonJohn and RegDwight.

You can't use people who are known by only one name. So for example you can't justify NeilMorrissey by referring to [[Morrissey]] from TheSmiths, cos his name is StephenMorrissey.

You can't have BoyGeorge. You just can't.

Fictional Characters are **not** allowed. So no ClarkKent.

If you pick a name with a potentially contentious surname - for example ChrisRock, you may wish to justify it by referring to another famous person in brackets afterwards - for example RockHudson. 

You cannot use a fictional character to justify a choice. For example you cannot use FoxMulder to justify MichaelJFox. 

Anyone can ask any other player to jusitfy a choice, if they feel the person is making the name up, or that the surname is not a real first name, by putting 'justify?' next to it. They should then deduct a point for that name until it is justified. If it isn't justified the person loses the point and the name is removed. RestlessBoy's decision is final in all disputes.

It is best to pre-emptively justify names by putting:

ChrisRock (RockHudson)- comedian (RestlessBoy)

You don't have to justify every name. If it's obviously a potential first name then it's fine.

==Scoring==

If you want to play for points then put your name next to all names you add to the list. Add up your own points and add them to the [[CraigDavidGameScores Scores Page]]. If you cheat we'll catch you.

You get 1 point for every name you add to the list. If you are the first person to think of a given surname then you get 3 points. If you think of a famous person with a double-barrelled surname where all three names are first names then you get 10 points.

The game goes on forever so there will be no ultimate winner. The aim is to have the most points at any given time.

==The Unenforcable Rule==

Just use your brain to think of names. Don't just type something into the imdb and list everyone who comes up. This is cheating, there's no way of proving you did it but it's still cheating.

======Marketplace======

You walk over to the elf. Before you can open your mouth to speak, the elf starts talking.

"Well, well. If it isn't 'the great super-squirrel, Tootie'."
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]

Talk:

[[TnS046 'I sense I'm being mocked...']]
[[TnS047 'Yes, it is. What of it?']]
[[TnS048 'Shut up, crazy old person. And don't touch me!']]
{{InvHasOne item="Salt" link="TnS049" text="'I have the merchandise'"}}

======Marketplace======

"I sense I'm being mocked..." you say to the elf. It's something of an understatement. The elf is laughing so hard at his own joke and your response that he has fallen to the ground and is rolling around, clutching his ribcage. You realise he can't see what you're doing.
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]
[[TnS050 Steal something from his stall]]

Talk:

[[TnS051 'Hey! Stop that!']]
[[TnS052 'It wasn't that funny']]
[[TnS053 'Stop that or I'll nick your stuff!']]

======Marketplace======

Just as the old elf starts to climb out from under the stall, you grab the money bag and stuff it into your utility belt, where it creates a suspicious bulge. You wish briefly that your costume wasn't made from skin-tight lycra...

{{InvPickup item="Bag Of Money"}}

The elf appears on the other side of the stall and dusts himself down. He starts talking again.

"Now then, young squirrel. What can I do for you?" He looks at the stall for a minute. "Strange, my bag of toenail clippings seems to have gone..."

{{InvDrop item="Bag Of Money"}}{{InvPickup item="Bag Of Toenail Clippings"}}
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]

Talk:

[[TnS060 'Who are you?']]
[[TnS061 'Why aren't there any other elves about? This is a marketplace isn't it?']]
[[TnS062 'I'm here investigating a distress call. You wouldn't know anything about it, would you?']]

======Marketplace======

You can hear the old elf struggling to get up, so you quickly grab the teapot. Your skin-tight lycra outfit doesn't really leave you with anywhere to hide it, so you put it behind your back.

{{InvPickup item="Double-Ended Teapot"}}

The elf pops up behind the stall and dusts himself off. Then he looks at you, and there is something piercing about his gaze that makes you think he's not such a fool after all. His eyes flicker to the stall and back to you, but he says nothing about the teapot. "Now then, young squirrel. Can I help you?"
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]

Talk:

[[TnS060 'Who are you?']]
[[TnS061 'Why aren't there any other elves about? This is a marketplace isn't it?']]
[[TnS062 'I'm here investigating a distress call. You wouldn't know anything about it, would you?']]

======Marketplace======

You can hear the old elf getting up, so you quickly grab the ornamental sugar bowl. There are no pockets in your skin-tight lycra, so you clip it to the back of your utility belt, where your cape covers it.

{{InvPickup item="Sugar Bowl"}}

The old elf emerges from behind the stall and squints at you. "Well, young squirrel. What is it you want?" He asks. He sounds pissed off.
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]

Talk:

[[TnS060 'Who are you?']]
[[TnS061 'Why aren't there any other elves about? This is a marketplace isn't it?']]
[[TnS062 'I'm here investigating a distress call. You wouldn't know anything about it, would you?']]

======Marketplace======

The elf is still under the stall, although the laughter is subsiding. Before he can stand up and see you, you grab the corkscrew thingy and stick it into your utility belt, pulling your cape over it so he won't see.

{{InvPickup item="Corkscrew Thingy"}}

The elf appears from behind the stall, one hand on his back. "Ouch, that stings!" He exclaims.

"I have some questions I'm hoping you can answer", you tell him.

"In a moment." The elf says. "First, give me back my de-wormer."

You look up when he says this. The foolish expression is gone from his wrinked face, and his eyes fix you with a scowl so severe you unintentionally step back.
----
What now?

[[TnS059 Return Corkscrew Thingy]]
[[TnS002 Leave]]

======Marketplace======

{{Test if="getToken(visMar) = 0" then="You land in the marketplace, and hide the Squirrel-mobile under an abandoned stall. You agree to split up and search for the source of the distress signal, and your partner soon wanders off, leaving you alone." else="You are back in the marketplace where you originally landed."}}

The marketplace is a large, cobbled square with a stone fountain in the centre. Roads lead off from each corner, to the south towards a hill with an imposing palace on it, to the north towards some woodland, to the east, further into the town and to the west, into what looks like a swamp.

The square itself is lined with sagging wooden stalls, each one draped with brightly coloured cloth. They have slogans painted on them in glittering paint, you can see that the nearest one reads: "Feeling Low? Remember Rainbows!!".

{{Test if="getToken(ptf) = 1" then="To your surprise, the stick the old man gave you starts to vibrate. You pull it out, and it twists to point at the fountain."}}{{SetToken token="visMar" value="+1"}}{{Test if="getToken(visMar) > 5" then="A short elf leaning heavily on a stick cackles at you from behind one of the deserted stalls."}}
----

======Marketplace======

The elf's hand appears above the stall, clutching his stick. Whilst he is still flailing around, you grab the piece of obvious junk. It fits up your sleeve quite easily, slim enough that it doesn't show through your skin-tight lycra super-squirrel outfit.

{{InvPickup item="Piece Of Obvious Junk"}}

The old elf appears on the other side of the stall, glances over the table but doesn't seem to notice that the junk is gone, and then smiles at you. "Now then. What is it that you want, young squirrel?"
----
What now?

[[TnS002 Leave]]

Talk:

[[TnS060 'Who are you?']]
[[TnS061 'Why aren't there any other elves about? This is a marketplace isn't it?']]
[[TnS062 'I'm here investigating a distress call. You wouldn't know anything about it, would you?']]

======Marketplace======

You take a look at the stuff on the stall. At the back is a small bag which looks like it might contain money. In the middle are some assortments of the sort of rubbish you normally find in the back of cupboards that no-one's been in for years. You can see a teapot with two spouts and no handle, an ornamental sugar bowl in the shape of an ornamental milk jug, some sort of corkscrew-like utensil with alarming red stains, and something which is obviously junk.

The laughter under the table is beginning to subside. You have time to steal one thing, if you're quick.
----

I refuse to be defined. (hang on... Damn!)

ClaireMelton is a pioneer in the theory that the best way to define the difference between a game and a sport is to determine whether or not StephenHawking can participate in it - if he can, it's a game; if he can't, it's a sport. In other to try to prove her wrong, RockMonkey-users are encouraged to contribute to lists of GamesStephenHawkingCantPlay and SportsStephenHawkingCanPlay.
